<!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <meta charset="UTF-8"> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"> <title>UniPilot - Inquiry Form</title> <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css"> </head> <body> <!-- Header Section with Logo --> <header> <div class="logo-container"> <!-- UniPilot Logo --> <img src="/Users/baselto/Desktop/UniPilot/assets/20f8b1fa-ec1b-43e1-a26d-3920a2e4061a.png" alt="UniPilot Logo" class="logo"> </div> <h1>Welcome to UniPilot</h1> <p>Your path to studying in Germany starts here.</p> </header> <!-- Inquiry Form Section --> <section class="form-section"> <h2>Inquiry Form</h2> <p>Fill out the form below and we'll guide you through the process of studying in Germany:</p> <form action="https://api.web3forms.com/submit" method="POST"> <!-- Space for Access Key: Replace with your own access key from Web3Forms --> <input type="hidden" name="access_key" value="b02abaea-8ef1-4c2a-ad71-40ce082c385c"> #here is the access key received from web3forms <!-- Name Field --> <label for="name">Full Name</label> <input type="text" id="name" name="name" required> <!-- Email Field --> <label for="email">Email Address</label> <input type="email" id="email" name="email" required> <!-- Message Field --> <label for="message">Message</label> <textarea id="message" name="message" rows="4" required></textarea> <!-- Submit Button --> <button type="submit">Submit Inquiry</button> </form> </section> <!-- Footer Section --> <footer> <p>&copy; 2025 UniPilot. All rights reserved.</p> </footer> </body> </html> this is the perfect code. now how to save it as a proper website with the name Unipilot
ChatGPT said:

To save and publish your website with the name "UniPilot," follow these steps:

1. Create a Folder for Your Website Files

Create a folder on your computer where all the website files will be stored. For example:

  • Website Folder: UniPilot

Inside this folder, place your files:

  • index.html (the file you just created with the inquiry form)

  • styles.css (if you have a separate CSS file for styling)

  • Any other assets (e.g., assets/logo.png for your logo)

2. Save Your HTML File

Make sure you save your HTML file as index.html in the root of the folder. This is the default file that browsers will open when someone visits your website.

For example, save it as:

bash
UniPilot/index.html

3. Create or Update the CSS File (styles.css)

If you have custom styles for your website, you should create or update a CSS file (e.g., styles.css) and link it in your index.html file.

If you don’t have a CSS file yet, you can create it by adding a simple CSS file (styles.css) to the same folder. For example:

bash
UniPilot/styles.css

If you already have CSS code (from your previous messages), make sure it's included in the HTML file like this:

html
<link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">

4. Add the Assets Folder (Optional)

If you have any images (e.g., logos) used in your website, create an assets folder to store them. For example:

bash
UniPilot/assets/logo.png

Make sure that the src path to the logo in the HTML is correct, like:

html
<img src="assets/logo.png" alt="UniPilot Logo" class="logo">

5. Test Locally

Before publishing the website, you should test it locally on your computer:

  1. Open the index.html file in a web browser by double-clicking it. It should open your website locally in the browser.

  2. Check that the form works as expected and the logo and styling appear correctly.

6. Publish Your Website (Optional Hosting)

Once you’ve tested it locally, you’ll want to publish your website so that others can access it on the internet.

Option 1: Host with GitHub Pages (Free)

GitHub Pages is a free hosting service for static websites. Here’s how you can use it:

  1. Create a GitHub Account if you don’t already have one: https://github.com/

  2. Create a Repository:

    • Go to your GitHub profile.

    • Click the + sign on the top right and select New Repository.

    • Name your repository UniPilot (or any name you prefer).

    • Set it to public and click Create repository.

  3. Upload Your Website Files:

    • After creating the repository, go to the repository page.

    • Click Add file → Upload files and upload all the files (HTML, CSS, assets).

    • Once uploaded, click Commit changes.

  4. Activate GitHub Pages:

    • Go to the Settings of the repository.

    • Scroll down to the GitHub Pages section.

    • Under Source, select main or master as the branch.

    • Click Save.

  5. Access Your Website:

    • Your website will be live at: https://your-username.github.io/UniPilot/

Option 2: Host with Netlify (Free)

  1. Create a Netlify Account: https://www.netlify.com/

  2. Deploy Website:

    • Click New site from Git or drag and drop your folder (with index.html, styles.css, and the assets folder) into the Netlify dashboard.

    • Netlify will automatically deploy your site.

  3. Access Your Website:

    • You will receive a URL like https://your-site-name.netlify.app.

Option 3: Host with Vercel (Free)

  1. Create a Vercel Account: https://vercel.com/

  2. Deploy Website:

    • Follow the steps to import your project from GitHub or drag and drop your website files.

  3. Access Your Website:

    • Vercel will provide a unique URL for your website.

7. Use a Custom Domain (Optional)

If you want to use a custom domain like www.unipilot.com, you will need to:

  1. Purchase a Domain: You can use domain providers like Namecheap, GoDaddy, or Google Domains.

  2. Link Your Domain to Your Hosting: Follow the documentation provided by the hosting platform (GitHub Pages, Netlify, or Vercel) to point your domain to the hosted website.

In Summary:

  1. Create a folder for your website files.

  2. Save the index.html and styles.css in the folder, along with any image assets.

  3. Test locally by opening the index.html file in your browser.

  4. Deploy the website using GitHub Pages, Netlify, or Vercel.

  5. Optionally, set up a custom domain for a more professional URL.

Let me know if you need help with any specific step!

You said:
is there any way to use the .com extension instead of index.html
ChatGPT said:

Yes, you can definitely use a .com domain for your website instead of accessing it through index.html. To achieve this, you'll need to purchase a custom domain (e.g., unipilot.com) and then point it to your website's files, either hosted on GitHub Pages, Netlify, or Vercel. Here’s how you can do it:

Steps to Use a .com Domain Instead of index.html:

1. Purchase a Custom Domain (e.g., unipilot.com)

You need to buy a domain name from a domain registrar. Some popular domain registrars are:

  • Namecheap

  • GoDaddy

  • Google Domains

  • Bluehost

Follow the steps to:

  1. Search for your domain name (e.g., unipilot.com).

  2. Purchase the domain for a yearly fee (usually around $10–$20 per year depending on the domain name).

2. Host Your Website (GitHub Pages, Netlify, or Vercel)

After purchasing your domain, you will need to deploy your website to a hosting service like GitHub Pages, Netlify, or Vercel. These platforms provide free hosting for static websites.

Option 1: GitHub Pages (Free)

  1. Create a GitHub Account (if you don’t already have one): GitHub

  2. Create a Repository for your website:

    • Go to your GitHub profile → click the + on the top right → select New Repository.

    • Name your repository something like UniPilot.

  3. Upload your website files:

    • In the repository, click Add file → Upload files and upload your HTML, CSS, and assets.

  4. Enable GitHub Pages:

    • Go to Settings → scroll down to GitHub Pages.

    • In the Source section, select the main or master branch.

    • After saving, GitHub Pages will give you a link to access your website, e.g., https://username.github.io/UniPilot/.

Option 2: Netlify (Free)

  1. Sign up for Netlify: Netlify Sign Up

  2. Deploy your site:

    • You can drag and drop your website folder (containing index.html, styles.css, and other assets) into the Netlify dashboard for instant deployment.

  3. Get your unique Netlify URL: After deployment, Netlify will provide a link to your site, e.g., https://your-site-name.netlify.app.

Option 3: Vercel (Free)

  1. Sign up for Vercel: Vercel Sign Up

  2. Deploy your site:

    • Connect your GitHub or GitLab account to Vercel.

    • Push your website files to GitHub and import your GitHub repository into Vercel.

  3. Get your Vercel URL: After deployment, Vercel will give you a URL like https://your-site-name.vercel.app.

3. Set Up Your Custom Domain with Your Hosting Service

Now that your website is live, the next step is to link your custom domain (unipilot.com) to your hosted website.

For GitHub Pages:

  1. Go to your GitHub repository and open Settings.

  2. Scroll to the GitHub Pages section.

  3. Under Custom domain, enter your domain name (e.g., unipilot.com) and click Save.

  4. Update DNS settings at your domain registrar (where you bought unipilot.com):

    • Log in to your domain registrar account (e.g., Namecheap, GoDaddy).

    • Go to DNS settings.

    • Add the following A records:

      • @ → 185.199.108.153

      • @ → 185.199.109.153

      • @ → 185.199.110.153

      • @ → 185.199.111.153

    • CNAME record: Set a CNAME record for www pointing to username.github.io.

For Netlify:

  1. Go to your Netlify dashboard.

  2. Select your website and click on Domain Settings.

  3. Under Custom Domains, click Add custom domain.

  4. Enter unipilot.com and follow the instructions to verify ownership.

  5. Update DNS settings at your domain registrar:

    • Set CNAME record for www to point to your-site-name.netlify.app.

    • Set A records for the root domain (unipilot.com) to the Netlify IP addresses.

For Vercel:

  1. Go to your Vercel dashboard.

  2. Select your project and click on Settings.

  3. Under Domains, click Add Domain and enter unipilot.com.

  4. Follow the instructions to configure your DNS settings:

    • Add a CNAME record for www pointing to cname.vercel-dns.com.

    • Set A records for the root domain to the provided Vercel IP addresses.

4. Verify Your Custom Domain

After updating your DNS settings, it may take some time (up to 48 hours) for the changes to take effect. Once the DNS settings propagate, you should be able to access your website via https://unipilot.com instead of index.html.

In Summary:

  1. Buy a custom domain like unipilot.com from a domain registrar.

  2. Host your website using GitHub Pages, Netlify, or Vercel.

  3. Link your domain to the hosted website by updating DNS settings at your registrar.

  4. Wait for DNS propagation (could take up to 48 hours).

  5. Access your website via https://unipilot.com.

Let me know if you need help with any specific step or if you'd like further guidance!

You said:
<!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <meta charset="UTF-8"> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"> <title>UniPilot - Inquiry Form</title> <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css"> </head> <body> <!-- Header Section with Logo --> <header> <div class="logo-container"> <!-- UniPilot Logo --> <img src="/Users/baselto/Desktop/UniPilot/assets/20f8b1fa-ec1b-43e1-a26d-3920a2e4061a.png" alt="UniPilot Logo" class="logo"> </div> <h1>Welcome to UniPilot</h1> <p>Your path to studying in Germany starts here.</p> </header> <!-- Inquiry Form Section --> <section class="form-section"> <h2>Inquiry Form</h2> <p>Fill out the form below and we'll guide you through the process of studying in Germany:</p> <form action="https://api.web3forms.com/submit" method="POST"> <!-- Space for Access Key: Replace with your own access key from Web3Forms --> <input type="hidden" name="access_key" value="b02abaea-8ef1-4c2a-ad71-40ce082c385c"> <!-- Name Field --> <label for="name">Full Name</label> <input type="text" id="name" name="name" required> <!-- Email Field --> <label for="email">Email Address</label> <input type="email" id="email" name="email" required> <!-- Message Field --> <label for="message">Message</label> <textarea id="message" name="message" rows="4" required></textarea> <!-- Submit Button --> <button type="submit">Submit Inquiry</button> </form> </section> <!-- Footer Section --> <footer> <p>&copy; 2025 UniPilot. All rights reserved.</p> </footer> </body> </html> if I want to add one more emial id which receives the information of filled form how to add in this script
ChatGPT said:

To add multiple recipients for the form submissions in Web3Forms, you would need to configure Web3Forms to send the form data to multiple email addresses. However, Web3Forms does not natively support specifying multiple recipients within the form submission.

Solution Options:

Here are two solutions you can use to achieve this:

Option 1: Use Web3Forms for Multiple Recipients

Web3Forms doesn't have a built-in method to specify multiple recipients in the form directly. But you can configure Web3Forms to send the form data to one email address (the primary one) and then set up email forwarding for that account to forward emails to the additional recipient.

Here’s how you can forward the form submissions to multiple email addresses:

  1. Set up email forwarding:

    • Log into your email account (e.g., Gmail, Outlook).

    • Set up forwarding from your primary email (the one receiving form submissions) to the additional email address you want to receive the form data.

Option 2: Modify Your Script with a Backend (Optional)

If you'd like to handle the form submission directly through your own backend (e.g., using Python Flask or PHP), you can handle sending emails to multiple recipients from your own server. Here’s how to handle that using Flask:

Modified HTML Form with Web3Forms (Same as Your Code)

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>UniPilot - Inquiry Form</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
</head>
<body>
    <!-- Header Section with Logo -->
    <header>
        <div class="logo-container">
            <!-- UniPilot Logo -->
            <img src="/Users/baselto/Desktop/UniPilot/assets/20f8b1fa-ec1b-43e1-a26d-3920a2e4061a.png" alt="UniPilot Logo" class="logo">
        </div>
        <h1>Welcome to UniPilot</h1>
        <p>Your path to studying in Germany starts here.</p>
    </header>       
        
    <!-- Inquiry Form Section -->
    <section class="form-section">
        <h2>Inquiry Form</h2>
        <p>Fill out the form below and we'll guide you through the process of studying in Germany:</p>
        <form action="https://api.web3forms.com/submit" method="POST">
            <!-- Space for Access Key: Replace with your own access key from Web3Forms -->
            <input type="hidden" name="access_key" value="b02abaea-8ef1-4c2a-ad71-40ce082c385c"> 

            <!-- Name Field -->
            <label for="name">Full Name</label>
            <input type="text" id="name" name="name" required>

            <!-- Email Field -->
            <label for="email">Email Address</label>
            <input type="email" id="email" name="email" required>

            <!-- Message Field -->
            <label for="message">Message</label>
            <textarea id="message" name="message" rows="4" required></textarea>

            <!-- Submit Button -->
            <button type="submit">Submit Inquiry</button>
        </form>
    </section>

    <!-- Footer Section -->
    <footer>
        <p>&copy; 2025 UniPilot. All rights reserved.</p>
    </footer>
</body>
</html>

Steps for Option 1: Use Email Forwarding (Simpler Method)

  1. Log into the email account where you want the form data to be sent (e.g., Gmail, Outlook).

  2. Set up email forwarding:

    • In Gmail: Go to Settings → Forwarding and POP/IMAP → Add a forwarding address. Enter the second email address where you want the form data to be forwarded.

    • In Outlook: Go to Settings → Mail → Forwarding → Start forwarding to the second email address.

  3. Configure Web3Forms to send to the first email.

    • When the form is submitted, the data will be sent to the first email address, and it will then be forwarded to the second address via the forwarding settings.

Alternative Option 2: Implement a Backend for Multiple Recipients

If you want more control over the form submission (e.g., sending it to multiple recipients directly from the server), you can implement a backend system, such as Flask or PHP, to send the form data to multiple recipients. Here's how you can do it in Flask:

  1. Set up Flask to handle the form:

    • Collect the form data in the Flask app.

    • Use Flask-Mail to send emails to multiple recipients.

  2. Flask Example to Send Emails to Multiple Recipients:

python
from flask import Flask, render_template, request
from flask_mail import Mail, Message

app = Flask(__name__)

# Flask-Mail configuration
app.config['MAIL_SERVER'] = 'smtp.gmail.com'
app.config['MAIL_PORT'] = 465  # For SSL
app.config['MAIL_USE_SSL'] = True
app.config['MAIL_USERNAME'] = 'your-email@gmail.com'  # Replace with your email
app.config['MAIL_PASSWORD'] = 'your-email-password'  # Replace with your email password (or App Password)
app.config['MAIL_DEFAULT_SENDER'] = 'your-email@gmail.com'  # Replace with your email

mail = Mail(app)

@app.route('/inquiry', methods=['POST'])
def inquiry():
    if request.method == 'POST':
        name = request.form['name']
        email = request.form['email']
        message = request.form['message']

        # Create the email message
        msg = Message(subject="New Inquiry from UniPilot",
                      recipients=["email1@example.com", "email2@example.com"],  # Multiple recipients
                      body=f"New inquiry received:\n\nName: {name}\nEmail: {email}\nMessage: {message}")

        # Send the email
        try:
            mail.send(msg)
            return "Your inquiry has been submitted!"
        except Exception as e:
            return f"Error: {str(e)}"

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run(debug=True)

  • In this case, you can send form submissions to multiple recipients (e.g., email1@example.com and email2@example.com) directly from your backend.

Summary:

  • Option 1: Use Web3Forms to submit the form data to one email, and set up email forwarding from your email provider to forward it to additional recipients.

  • Option 2: Set up a backend (e.g., Flask) to handle form submissions and send emails directly to multiple recipients.

Let me know if you'd like to implement the backend method or if you need further assistance!

To create a similar look and feel for the header section of your website as seen in the reference website you provided (YesGermany.com), we will replicate some of its design elements. Here's how we can adjust the code and add some necessary styles:

Main Changes:

  1. Logo & Navbar:

    • Add a logo on the left side and a navigation menu on the right side (just like the reference website).

    • The header should be sticky or fixed at the top for easy navigation.

  2. Colors and Typography:

    • Use colors similar to the ones on YesGermany.com (such as blue and white).

    • Adjust typography to match the style (font weight, font sizes).

  3. Button Styling:

    • Style the buttons to match the reference's modern and professional feel.

Updated HTML and CSS Code:

Here's the modified HTML for your platform based on the reference:

HTML (index.html):

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>UniPilot - Inquiry Form</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
</head>
<body>
    <!-- Header Section with Logo and Navigation -->
    <header class="header">
        <div class="logo-container">
            <!-- UniPilot Logo -->
            <img src="assets/logo.png" alt="UniPilot Logo" class="logo">
        </div>
        <nav class="navbar">
            <ul>
                <li><a href="#home">Home</a></li>
                <li><a href="#services">Services</a></li>
                <li><a href="#about">About Us</a></li>
                <li><a href="#contact">Contact</a></li>
            </ul>
        </nav>
    </header>

    <!-- Hero Section (Title and Tagline) -->
    <section class="hero">
        <h1>Welcome to UniPilot</h1>
        <p>Your path to studying in Germany starts here.</p>
    </section> 
        
    <!-- Inquiry Form Section -->
    <section class="form-section">
        <h2>Inquiry Form</h2>
        <p>Fill out the form below and we'll guide you through the process of studying in Germany:</p>
        <form action="https://api.web3forms.com/submit" method="POST">
            <input type="hidden" name="access_key" value="b02abaea-8ef1-4c2a-ad71-40ce082c385c">

            <!-- Name Field -->
            <label for="name">Full Name</label>
            <input type="text" id="name" name="name" required>

            <!-- Email Field -->
            <label for="email">Email Address</label>
            <input type="email" id="email" name="email" required>

            <!-- Message Field -->
            <label for="message">Message</label>
            <textarea id="message" name="message" rows="4" required></textarea>

            <!-- Submit Button -->
            <button type="submit">Submit Inquiry</button>
        </form>
    </section>

    <!-- Footer Section -->
    <footer>
        <p>&copy; 2025 UniPilot. All rights reserved.</p>
    </footer>
</body>
</html>

CSS (styles.css):

css
/* Global Styles */
* {
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
    box-sizing: border-box;
}

body {
    font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
    background-color: #f4f4f4;
    color: #333;
}

/* Header Styles */
.header {
    display: flex;
    justify-content: space-between;
    align-items: center;
    padding: 20px 50px;
    background-color: #003366; /* Dark Blue */
    position: sticky;
    top: 0;
    z-index: 100;
}

.logo-container .logo {
    width: 150px;
}

.navbar ul {
    list-style: none;
    display: flex;
}

.navbar ul li {
    margin-left: 20px;
}

.navbar ul li a {
    text-decoration: none;
    color: white;
    font-weight: bold;
    font-size: 1.1rem;
    transition: color 0.3s ease;
}

.navbar ul li a:hover {
    color: #ff6f61; /* Accent color */
}

/* Hero Section */
.hero {
    background-color: #f2f2f2;
    text-align: center;
    padding: 80px 0;
    color: #003366;
}

.hero h1 {
    font-size: 3rem;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.hero p {
    font-size: 1.5rem;
    color: #666;
}

/* Form Section */
.form-section {
    background-color: white;
    padding: 30px;
    margin: 40px auto;
    width: 50%;
    box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
}

.form-section h2 {
    font-size: 2rem;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.form-section label {
    font-size: 1rem;
    margin-bottom: 5px;
    display: block;
}

.form-section input,
.form-section textarea {
    width: 100%;
    padding: 12px;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
    border: 1px solid #ccc;
    border-radius: 5px;
    font-size: 1rem;
}

.form-section button {
    background-color: #003366; /* Dark Blue */
    color: white;
    font-size: 1.1rem;
    padding: 15px 20px;
    border: none;
    border-radius: 5px;
    cursor: pointer;
    width: 100%;
}

.form-section button:hover {
    background-color: #ff6f61; /* Accent color */
}

/* Footer Section */
footer {
    background-color: #003366;
    color: white;
    text-align: center;
    padding: 20px;
    margin-top: 40px;
}

footer p {
    font-size: 1rem;
}

You said:
ok now make changes in a way that wen contact is clicked in the top it takes you to the inquiry form. else if you are in the home section already then it stays blank. so when clicked on contact, you will be taken there to inquiry form
ChatGPT said:

To achieve the behavior where clicking on "Contact" in the navigation bar takes you to the inquiry form while keeping the "Contact" section visible when you're already on the inquiry form page, you can use anchors (hash links) in your navigation.

Here’s how you can make the required changes:

Steps:

  1. Update the Navigation Link:

    • Change the "Contact" link to use an anchor link that scrolls to the inquiry form section.

  2. Add an id to the Inquiry Form Section:

    • The anchor link will scroll to the form, so we need to give the inquiry form an id to target it.

  3. Update the Navigation Bar for Smooth Scrolling:

    • We can use smooth scrolling when the user clicks on the "Contact" link.

Updated HTML with Contact Link Scrolling to Inquiry Form:

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>UniPilot - Inquiry Form</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
</head>
<body>
    <!-- Header Section with Logo and Navigation -->
    <header class="header">
        <div class="logo-container">
            <!-- UniPilot Logo -->
            <img src="assets/logo.png" alt="UniPilot Logo" class="logo">
        </div>
        <nav class="navbar">
            <ul>
                <li><a href="#home">Home</a></li>
                <li><a href="#services">Services</a></li>
                <li><a href="#about">About Us</a></li>
                <li><a href="#contact">Contact</a></li>  <!-- Updated to link to the inquiry form -->
            </ul>
        </nav>
    </header>

    <!-- Hero Section (Title and Tagline) -->
    <section class="hero" id="home">
        <h1>Welcome to UniPilot</h1>
        <p>Your path to studying in Germany starts here.</p>
    </section> 
        
    <!-- Inquiry Form Section with ID for Smooth Scrolling -->
    <section class="form-section" id="contact">
        <h2>Inquiry Form</h2>
        <p>Fill out the form below and we'll guide you through the process of studying in Germany:</p>
        <form action="https://api.web3forms.com/submit" method="POST">
            <input type="hidden" name="access_key" value="b02abaea-8ef1-4c2a-ad71-40ce082c385c">

            <!-- Name Field -->
            <label for="name">Full Name</label>
            <input type="text" id="name" name="name" required>

            <!-- Email Field -->
            <label for="email">Email Address</label>
            <input type="email" id="email" name="email" required>

            <!-- Message Field -->
            <label for="message">Message</label>
            <textarea id="message" name="message" rows="4" required></textarea>

            <!-- Submit Button -->
            <button type="submit">Submit Inquiry</button>
        </form>
    </section>

    <!-- Footer Section -->
    <footer>
        <p>&copy; 2025 UniPilot. All rights reserved.</p>
    </footer>

    <script>
        // Smooth Scroll Behavior
        document.querySelectorAll('a[href^="#"]').forEach(anchor => {
            anchor.addEventListener("click", function(e) {
                e.preventDefault();

                document.querySelector(this.getAttribute("href")).scrollIntoView({
                    behavior: "smooth"
                });
            });
        });
    </script>
</body>
</html>

Explanation of Changes:

  1. Anchor Link for "Contact":

    • The <a href="#contact"> link now points to the id="contact" of the inquiry form section. This means when you click Contact, it will scroll you to the inquiry form.

  2. id="contact" on Inquiry Form Section:

    • This allows the "Contact" link in the navigation bar to target the inquiry form directly.

  3. Smooth Scrolling:

    • The JavaScript at the bottom enables smooth scrolling behavior when you click on the links in the navigation bar (it’s particularly useful for anchor links like #contact).

  4. Home Section:

    • The id="home" on the hero section will allow you to stay at the Home section even if you click on the Home link in the navigation bar.

How It Works:

  • Clicking on "Home" will stay at the home section (#home).

  • Clicking on "Contact" will smoothly scroll you to the inquiry form section (#contact).

Final Touches:

  • Make sure you test it locally first to see if the anchor links and smooth scrolling work as expected.

  • Upload the updated code once you are happy with the changes.

Let me know if you need further customization or assistance!

You said:
I mean when link is opened it is by default in the home section and home section is empty as there is nothing in home section right now but when contact is clicked you will be taken to the inquiry form
ChatGPT said:

Thank you for the clarification! Based on your description, you want the following behavior:

  1. When the website is opened, it should default to the Home section, but this section will remain empty for now (no content).

  2. When the "Contact" link is clicked in the navigation bar, the user will be taken directly to the Inquiry Form.

How to Implement This:

  1. Home section: This section will have no content for now, but will be visible when the page loads.

  2. Inquiry Form Section: The Contact link will smoothly scroll to the inquiry form section.

  3. Link behavior: The Contact link will only scroll to the inquiry form section when clicked, and if you're already on the home section, it will just stay on the home section.

Updated HTML and CSS Code:

Here’s how you can structure it:

HTML (index.html):

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>UniPilot - Inquiry Form</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
</head>
<body>
    <!-- Header Section with Logo and Navigation -->
    <header class="header">
        <div class="logo-container">
            <!-- UniPilot Logo -->
            <img src="assets/logo.png" alt="UniPilot Logo" class="logo">
        </div>
        <nav class="navbar">
            <ul>
                <li><a href="#home">Home</a></li>
                <li><a href="#services">Services</a></li>
                <li><a href="#about">About Us</a></li>
                <li><a href="#contact">Contact</a></li>  <!-- Link to inquiry form -->
            </ul>
        </nav>
    </header>

    <!-- Home Section (Empty for Now) -->
    <section class="hero" id="home">
        <!-- This section can be empty or used for other content later -->
        <h1>Welcome to UniPilot</h1>
        <p>Your path to studying in Germany starts here.</p>
    </section> 
        
    <!-- Inquiry Form Section with ID for Smooth Scrolling -->
    <section class="form-section" id="contact">
        <h2>Inquiry Form</h2>
        <p>Fill out the form below and we'll guide you through the process of studying in Germany:</p>
        <form action="https://api.web3forms.com/submit" method="POST">
            <input type="hidden" name="access_key" value="b02abaea-8ef1-4c2a-ad71-40ce082c385c">

            <!-- Name Field -->
            <label for="name">Full Name</label>
            <input type="text" id="name" name="name" required>

            <!-- Email Field -->
            <label for="email">Email Address</label>
            <input type="email" id="email" name="email" required>

            <!-- Message Field -->
            <label for="message">Message</label>
            <textarea id="message" name="message" rows="4" required></textarea>

            <!-- Submit Button -->
            <button type="submit">Submit Inquiry</button>
        </form>
    </section>

    <!-- Footer Section -->
    <footer>
        <p>&copy; 2025 UniPilot. All rights reserved.</p>
    </footer>

    <script>
        // Smooth Scroll Behavior
        document.querySelectorAll('a[href^="#"]').forEach(anchor => {
            anchor.addEventListener("click", function(e) {
                e.preventDefault();

                // Scroll to the targeted section (Inquiry Form or Home)
                document.querySelector(this.getAttribute("href")).scrollIntoView({
                    behavior: "smooth"
                });
            });
        });
    </script>
</body>
</html>

CSS (styles.css):

css
/* Global Styles */
* {
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
    box-sizing: border-box;
}

body {
    font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
    background-color: #f4f4f4;
    color: #333;
}

/* Header Styles */
.header {
    display: flex;
    justify-content: space-between;
    align-items: center;
    padding: 20px 50px;
    background-color: #003366; /* Dark Blue */
    position: sticky;
    top: 0;
    z-index: 100;
}

.logo-container .logo {
    width: 150px;
}

.navbar ul {
    list-style: none;
    display: flex;
}

.navbar ul li {
    margin-left: 20px;
}

.navbar ul li a {
    text-decoration: none;
    color: white;
    font-weight: bold;
    font-size: 1.1rem;
    transition: color 0.3s ease;
}

.navbar ul li a:hover {
    color: #ff6f61; /* Accent color */
}

/* Hero Section */
.hero {
    background-color: #f2f2f2;
    text-align: center;
    padding: 80px 0;
    color: #003366;
    min-height: 100vh; /* Ensures the home section takes full viewport height */
}

.hero h1 {
    font-size: 3rem;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.hero p {
    font-size: 1.5rem;
    color: #666;
}

/* Form Section */
.form-section {
    background-color: white;
    padding: 30px;
    margin: 40px auto;
    width: 50%;
    box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
}

.form-section h2 {
    font-size: 2rem;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.form-section label {
    font-size: 1rem;
    margin-bottom: 5px;
    display: block;
}

.form-section input,
.form-section textarea {
    width: 100%;
    padding: 12px;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
    border: 1px solid #ccc;
    border-radius: 5px;
    font-size: 1rem;
}

.form-section button {
    background-color: #003366; /* Dark Blue */
    color: white;
    font-size: 1.1rem;
    padding: 15px 20px;
    border: none;
    border-radius: 5px;
    cursor: pointer;
    width: 100%;
}

.form-section button:hover {
    background-color: #ff6f61; /* Accent color */
}

/* Footer Section */
footer {
    background-color: #003366;
    color: white;
    text-align: center;
    padding: 20px;
    margin-top: 40px;
}

footer p {
    font-size: 1rem;
}

Key Changes:

  1. Empty Home Section:

    • The Home section (id="home") is set with a min-height: 100vh;, meaning it will fill the full viewport height. This ensures that when you load the page, you’ll be at the Home section first, but it remains empty for now.

  2. Contact Link:

    • The "Contact" link in the navigation bar now scrolls smoothly to the Inquiry Form section (id="contact").

  3. Smooth Scroll Behavior:

    • When you click on any navigation link (like Home or Contact), it will smoothly scroll to the respective section.

  4. Flexibility in Layout:

    • If you decide to add content to the Home section later, it will fit seamlessly within the current layout.

How It Works:

  • When the page loads, you’ll be placed in the Home section (which is empty right now).

  • Clicking "Contact" in the navigation will smoothly scroll you to the Inquiry Form section.

Next Steps:

  1. Test Locally: Open index.html in your browser to test how it behaves.

  2. Add Content to the Home section later if you need to.

  3. Deploy the website to GitHub Pages, Netlify, or Vercel once everything works as expected.

Let me know if you need any further customization or assistance with deployment!

You said:
in the services section when I click it takes you to a section where there is SOP, LOR, CV, University shorlisting, money transfer, blocked account, aps certification, accomodation in germany, visa assistance, post-admission support. right now add all these services. in detail about which we will mention later
ChatGPT said:

To add the Services section with the listed services (SOP, LOR, CV, etc.) and make it functional in your website, you can create a dedicated section for these services and make sure that when you click on "Services" in the navigation bar, it scrolls down to this section.

Here’s how to add the Services section with placeholders for each service, and make the "Services" link scroll to this section.

Updated HTML Code with Services Section:

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>UniPilot - Inquiry Form</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
</head>
<body>
    <!-- Header Section with Logo and Navigation -->
    <header class="header">
        <div class="logo-container">
            <!-- UniPilot Logo -->
            <img src="assets/logo.png" alt="UniPilot Logo" class="logo">
        </div>
        <nav class="navbar">
            <ul>
                <li><a href="#home">Home</a></li>
                <li><a href="#services">Services</a></li>  <!-- Link to Services Section -->
                <li><a href="#about">About Us</a></li>
                <li><a href="#contact">Contact</a></li>  <!-- Link to Inquiry Form -->
            </ul>
        </nav>
    </header>

    <!-- Hero Section (Title and Tagline) -->
    <section class="hero" id="home">
        <h1>Welcome to UniPilot</h1>
        <p>Your path to studying in Germany starts here.</p>
    </section> 
        
    <!-- Services Section -->
    <section class="services-section" id="services">
        <h2>Our Services</h2>
        <p>We provide comprehensive services to help you navigate your journey to study in Germany.</p>
        
        <div class="service-item">
            <h3>SOP (Statement of Purpose)</h3>
            <p>We assist you in crafting a compelling Statement of Purpose that showcases your motivations and academic goals.</p>
        </div>
        
        <div class="service-item">
            <h3>LOR (Letter of Recommendation)</h3>
            <p>Our experts guide you in obtaining strong Letters of Recommendation from your professors or employers.</p>
        </div>
        
        <div class="service-item">
            <h3>CV (Curriculum Vitae)</h3>
            <p>We help you build a professional CV that highlights your skills and experiences for university applications.</p>
        </div>
        
        <div class="service-item">
            <h3>University Shortlisting</h3>
            <p>We assist you in shortlisting universities that match your academic profile, budget, and career goals.</p>
        </div>
        
        <div class="service-item">
            <h3>Money Transfer</h3>
            <p>Our platform offers guidance on safe and efficient money transfer options for your tuition fees and living expenses.</p>
        </div>
        
        <div class="service-item">
            <h3>Blocked Account</h3>
            <p>We help you open a blocked account, a necessary requirement for student visa applications in Germany.</p>
        </div>
        
        <div class="service-item">
            <h3>APS Certification</h3>
            <p>We provide guidance on obtaining the APS (Academic Evaluation Centre) certification for your application to German universities.</p>
        </div>
        
        <div class="service-item">
            <h3>Accommodation in Germany</h3>
            <p>We assist you in finding safe and affordable accommodation options in Germany during your study period.</p>
        </div>
        
        <div class="service-item">
            <h3>Visa Assistance</h3>
            <p>We guide you through the entire process of applying for a German student visa, including documentation and interview preparation.</p>
        </div>
        
        <div class="service-item">
            <h3>Post-Admission Support</h3>
            <p>We offer continued support after admission, including help with settling in, cultural integration, and academic guidance.</p>
        </div>
    </section>

    <!-- Inquiry Form Section -->
    <section class="form-section" id="contact">
        <h2>Inquiry Form</h2>
        <p>Fill out the form below and we'll guide you through the process of studying in Germany:</p>
        <form action="https://api.web3forms.com/submit" method="POST">
            <input type="hidden" name="access_key" value="b02abaea-8ef1-4c2a-ad71-40ce082c385c">

            <!-- Name Field -->
            <label for="name">Full Name</label>
            <input type="text" id="name" name="name" required>

            <!-- Email Field -->
            <label for="email">Email Address</label>
            <input type="email" id="email" name="email" required>

            <!-- Message Field -->
            <label for="message">Message</label>
            <textarea id="message" name="message" rows="4" required></textarea>

            <!-- Submit Button -->
            <button type="submit">Submit Inquiry</button>
        </form>
    </section>

    <!-- Footer Section -->
    <footer>
        <p>&copy; 2025 UniPilot. All rights reserved.</p>
    </footer>

    <script>
        // Smooth Scroll Behavior
        document.querySelectorAll('a[href^="#"]').forEach(anchor => {
            anchor.addEventListener("click", function(e) {
                e.preventDefault();

                document.querySelector(this.getAttribute("href")).scrollIntoView({
                    behavior: "smooth"
                });
            });
        });
    </script>
</body>
</html>

CSS (styles.css) for Services Section:

Here is the additional CSS to style the Services section:

css
/* Global Styles */
* {
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
    box-sizing: border-box;
}

body {
    font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
    background-color: #f4f4f4;
    color: #333;
}

/* Header Styles */
.header {
    display: flex;
    justify-content: space-between;
    align-items: center;
    padding: 20px 50px;
    background-color: #003366; /* Dark Blue */
    position: sticky;
    top: 0;
    z-index: 100;
}

.logo-container .logo {
    width: 150px;
}

.navbar ul {
    list-style: none;
    display: flex;
}

.navbar ul li {
    margin-left: 20px;
}

.navbar ul li a {
    text-decoration: none;
    color: white;
    font-weight: bold;
    font-size: 1.1rem;
    transition: color 0.3s ease;
}

.navbar ul li a:hover {
    color: #ff6f61; /* Accent color */
}

/* Hero Section */
.hero {
    background-color: #f2f2f2;
    text-align: center;
    padding: 80px 0;
    color: #003366;
}

.hero h1 {
    font-size: 3rem;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.hero p {
    font-size: 1.5rem;
    color: #666;
}

/* Services Section */
.services-section {
    background-color: white;
    padding: 30px;
    margin: 40px auto;
    width: 70%;
    box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
}

.services-section h2 {
    font-size: 2.5rem;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
    text-align: center;
}

.services-section p {
    font-size: 1.2rem;
    text-align: center;
    color: #666;
    margin-bottom: 40px;
}

.service-item {
    background-color: #f9f9f9;
    padding: 20px;
    margin-bottom: 15px;
    border-radius: 5px;
    box-shadow: 0 2px 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
}

.service-item h3 {
    font-size: 1.5rem;
    color: #003366;
}

.service-item p {
    font-size: 1rem;
    color: #555;
}

/* Form Section */
.form-section {
    background-color: white;
    padding: 30px;
    margin: 40px auto;
    width: 50%;
    box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
}

.form-section h2 {
    font-size: 2rem;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.form-section label {
    font-size: 1rem;
    margin-bottom: 5px;
    display: block;
}

.form-section input,
.form-section textarea {
    width: 100%;
    padding: 12px;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
    border: 1px solid #ccc;
    border-radius: 5px;
    font-size: 1rem;
}

.form-section button {
    background-color: #003366; /* Dark Blue */
    color: white;
    font-size: 1.1rem;
    padding: 15px 20px;
    border: none;
    border-radius: 5px;
    cursor: pointer;
    width: 100%;
}

.form-section button:hover {
    background-color: #ff6f61; /* Accent color */
}

/* Footer Section */
footer {
    background-color: #003366;
    color: white;
    text-align: center;
    padding: 20px;
    margin-top: 40px;
}

footer p {
    font-size: 1rem;
}

Summary of Changes:

  • Services Section: Added a dedicated section (id="services") that lists all the services you provide.

  • Service Items: Each service (e.g., SOP, LOR, CV, etc.) is listed with a title and description.

  • CSS Styling: The section is styled to look clean and professional with modern fonts and padding.

  • Navigation: Clicking on "Services" in the navigation bar smoothly scrolls to the Services section.

Now, you can fill in the details for each service as needed. When you click "Services" in the navigation bar, it will take you directly to the Services section with all your services listed.

Let me know if you need any further adjustments or help with deployment!

You said:
can you modify the services like this. I mean the arrangement
ChatGPT said:

Certainly! To make the Services section look similar to the layout in the image you've provided, we'll adjust the structure so that the services are displayed in cards or boxes side by side.

Here's how we can adjust the HTML and CSS:

  1. Cards Layout: We'll use flexbox to align the cards side by side.

  2. Each Service will be displayed in its own card with an icon/image, a title, and a description.

  3. Consistent Styling to match the design from the reference.

Updated HTML for Services Section:

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>UniPilot - Inquiry Form</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
</head>
<body>
    <!-- Header Section with Logo and Navigation -->
    <header class="header">
        <div class="logo-container">
            <!-- UniPilot Logo -->
            <img src="assets/logo.png" alt="UniPilot Logo" class="logo">
        </div>
        <nav class="navbar">
            <ul>
                <li><a href="#home">Home</a></li>
                <li><a href="#services">Services</a></li>  <!-- Link to Services Section -->
                <li><a href="#about">About Us</a></li>
                <li><a href="#contact">Contact</a></li>  <!-- Link to Inquiry Form -->
            </ul>
        </nav>
    </header>

    <!-- Hero Section (Title and Tagline) -->
    <section class="hero" id="home">
        <h1>Welcome to UniPilot</h1>
        <p>Your path to studying in Germany starts here.</p>
    </section> 
        
    <!-- Services Section -->
    <section class="services-section" id="services">
        <h2>Our Services</h2>
        <p>We provide comprehensive services to help you navigate your journey to study in Germany.</p>
        
        <div class="services-container">
            <!-- Service Card 1: SOP -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/sop-icon.png" alt="SOP Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>SOP (Statement of Purpose)</h3>
                <p>We assist you in crafting a compelling Statement of Purpose that showcases your motivations and academic goals.</p>
            </div>
            
            <!-- Service Card 2: LOR -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/lor-icon.png" alt="LOR Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>LOR (Letter of Recommendation)</h3>
                <p>Our experts guide you in obtaining strong Letters of Recommendation from your professors or employers.</p>
            </div>
            
            <!-- Service Card 3: CV -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/cv-icon.png" alt="CV Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>CV (Curriculum Vitae)</h3>
                <p>We help you build a professional CV that highlights your skills and experiences for university applications.</p>
            </div>
            
            <!-- Service Card 4: University Shortlisting -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/university-icon.png" alt="University Shortlisting Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>University Shortlisting</h3>
                <p>We assist you in shortlisting universities that match your academic profile, budget, and career goals.</p>
            </div>
            
            <!-- Service Card 5: Money Transfer -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/money-transfer-icon.png" alt="Money Transfer Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>Money Transfer</h3>
                <p>Our platform offers guidance on safe and efficient money transfer options for your tuition fees and living expenses.</p>
            </div>
            
            <!-- Service Card 6: Blocked Account -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/blocked-account-icon.png" alt="Blocked Account Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>Blocked Account</h3>
                <p>We help you open a blocked account, a necessary requirement for student visa applications in Germany.</p>
            </div>
            
            <!-- Service Card 7: APS Certification -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/aps-icon.png" alt="APS Certification Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>APS Certification</h3>
                <p>We provide guidance on obtaining the APS (Academic Evaluation Centre) certification for your application to German universities.</p>
            </div>
            
            <!-- Service Card 8: Accommodation in Germany -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/accommodation-icon.png" alt="Accommodation Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>Accommodation in Germany</h3>
                <p>We assist you in finding safe and affordable accommodation options in Germany during your study period.</p>
            </div>
            
            <!-- Service Card 9: Visa Assistance -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/visa-icon.png" alt="Visa Assistance Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>Visa Assistance</h3>
                <p>We guide you through the entire process of applying for a German student visa, including documentation and interview preparation.</p>
            </div>
            
            <!-- Service Card 10: Post-Admission Support -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/post-admission-icon.png" alt="Post Admission Support Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>Post-Admission Support</h3>
                <p>We offer continued support after admission, including help with settling in, cultural integration, and academic guidance.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>

    <!-- Inquiry Form Section -->
    <section class="form-section" id="contact">
        <h2>Inquiry Form</h2>
        <p>Fill out the form below and we'll guide you through the process of studying in Germany:</p>
        <form action="https://api.web3forms.com/submit" method="POST">
            <input type="hidden" name="access_key" value="b02abaea-8ef1-4c2a-ad71-40ce082c385c">

            <!-- Name Field -->
            <label for="name">Full Name</label>
            <input type="text" id="name" name="name" required>

            <!-- Email Field -->
            <label for="email">Email Address</label>
            <input type="email" id="email" name="email" required>

            <!-- Message Field -->
            <label for="message">Message</label>
            <textarea id="message" name="message" rows="4" required></textarea>

            <!-- Submit Button -->
            <button type="submit">Submit Inquiry</button>
        </form>
    </section>

    <!-- Footer Section -->
    <footer>
        <p>&copy; 2025 UniPilot. All rights reserved.</p>
    </footer>

    <script>
        // Smooth Scroll Behavior
        document.querySelectorAll('a[href^="#"]').forEach(anchor => {
            anchor.addEventListener("click", function(e) {
                e.preventDefault();

                document.querySelector(this.getAttribute("href")).scrollIntoView({
                    behavior: "smooth"
                });
            });
        });
    </script>
</body>
</html>

Updated CSS for Services Section:

css
/* Global Styles */
* {
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
    box-sizing: border-box;
}

body {
    font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
    background-color: #f4f4f4;
    color: #333;
}

/* Header Styles */
.header {
    display: flex;
    justify-content: space-between;
    align-items: center;
    padding: 20px 50px;
    background-color: #003366; /* Dark Blue */
    position: sticky;
    top: 0;
    z-index: 100;
}

.logo-container .logo {
    width: 150px;
}

.navbar ul {
    list-style: none;
    display: flex;
}

.navbar ul li {
    margin-left: 20px;
}

.navbar ul li a {
    text-decoration: none;
    color: white;
    font-weight: bold;
    font-size: 1.1rem;
    transition: color 0.3s ease;
}

.navbar ul li a:hover {
    color: #ff6f61; /* Accent color */
}

/* Hero Section */
.hero {
    background-color: #f2f2f2;
    text-align: center;
    padding: 80px 0;
    color: #003366;
}

.hero h1 {
    font-size: 3rem;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.hero p {
    font-size: 1.5rem;
    color: #666;
}

/* Services Section */
.services-section {
    background-color: white;
    padding: 30px;
    margin: 40px auto;
    width: 80%;
    box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
}

.services-section h2 {
    font-size: 2.5rem;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
    text-align: center;
}

.services-section p {
    font-size: 1.2rem;
    text-align: center;
    color: #666;
    margin-bottom: 40px;
}

/* Services Card Container */
.services-container {
    display: flex;
    flex-wrap: wrap;
    justify-content: space-between;
}

.service-card {
    background-color: #f9f9f9;
    padding: 20px;
    width: 30%;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
    border-radius: 5px;
    box-shadow: 0 2px 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
    text-align: center;
    transition: transform 0.3s ease;
}

.service-card:hover {
    transform: translateY(-10px); /* Hover effect */
}

.service-icon {
    width: 60px;
    height: 60px;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.service-card h3 {
    font-size: 1.5rem;
    color: #003366;
    margin-bottom: 15px;
}

.service-card p {
    font-size: 1rem;
    color: #555;
}

/* Form Section */
.form-section {
    background-color: white;
    padding: 30px;
    margin: 40px auto;
    width: 50%;
    box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
}

.form-section h2 {
    font-size: 2rem;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.form-section label {
    font-size: 1rem;
    margin-bottom: 5px;
    display: block;
}

.form-section input,
.form-section textarea {
    width: 100%;
    padding: 12px;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
    border: 1px solid #ccc;
    border-radius: 5px;
    font-size: 1rem;
}

.form-section button {
    background-color: #003366; /* Dark Blue */
    color: white;
    font-size: 1.1rem;
    padding: 15px 20px;
    border: none;
    border-radius: 5px;
    cursor: pointer;
    width: 100%;
}

.form-section button:hover {
    background-color: #ff6f61; /* Accent color */
}

/* Footer Section */
footer {
    background-color: #003366;
    color: white;
    text-align: center;
    padding: 20px;
    margin-top: 40px;
}

footer p {
    font-size: 1rem;
}

Key Changes:

  1. Service Cards:

    • Each service (e.g., SOP, LOR, CV, etc.) is now displayed in a card format with an icon, title, and description.

    • Cards are styled to look modern and responsive.

  2. Flexbox Layout:

    • The services-container uses flexbox to align the cards side by side.

    • When the screen size is reduced (e.g., on mobile devices), the cards will stack vertically due to flex-wrap: wrap;.

  3. Hover Effect:

    • Added a hover effect on the service cards to make them lift slightly when hovered over (transform: translateY(-10px)).

Next Steps:

  1. Update the Images: Replace the placeholder image paths (assets/sop-icon.png, etc.) with actual images or icons that represent each service.

  2. Test: Test the design in a browser to ensure everything is displaying as expected.

  3. Deploy: Once satisfied, you can deploy the website.

Let me know if you need more assistance with this design or have other requests!

  1. Student Health Insurance

  2. Student Flight Tickets

  • Increase the width of the Inquiry Form to make it more spacious.

Here’s the updated code:

Updated HTML (index.html):

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>UniPilot - Inquiry Form</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
</head>
<body>
    <!-- Header Section with Logo and Navigation -->
    <header class="header">
        <div class="logo-container">
            <!-- UniPilot Logo -->
            <img src="assets/logo.png" alt="UniPilot Logo" class="logo">
        </div>
        <nav class="navbar">
            <ul>
                <li><a href="#home">Home</a></li>
                <li><a href="#services">Services</a></li>  <!-- Link to Services Section -->
                <li><a href="#about">About Us</a></li>
                <li><a href="#contact">Contact</a></li>  <!-- Link to Inquiry Form -->
            </ul>
        </nav>
    </header>

    <!-- Hero Section (Title and Tagline) -->
    <section class="hero" id="home">
        <h1>Welcome to UniPilot</h1>
        <p>Your path to studying in Germany starts here.</p>
    </section> 
        
    <!-- Services Section -->
    <section class="services-section" id="services">
        <h2>Our Services</h2>
        <p>We provide comprehensive services to help you navigate your journey to study in Germany.</p>
        
        <div class="services-container">
            <!-- Service Card 1: SOP -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/sop-icon.png" alt="SOP Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>SOP (Statement of Purpose)</h3>
                <p>We assist you in crafting a compelling Statement of Purpose that showcases your motivations and academic goals.</p>
            </div>

                <p>Our experts guide you in obtaining strong Letters of Recommendation from your professors or employers.</p>
            </div>
            
            <!-- Service Card 3: CV -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/cv-icon.png" alt="CV Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>CV (Curriculum Vitae)</h3>
                <p>We help you build a professional CV that highlights your skills and experiences for university applications.</p>
            </div>
            
            <!-- Service Card 4: University Shortlisting -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/university-icon.png" alt="University Shortlisting Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>University Shortlisting</h3>
                <p>We assist you in shortlisting universities that match your academic profile, budget, and career goals.</p>
            </div>
            
            <!-- Service Card 5: Money Transfer -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/money-transfer-icon.png" alt="Money Transfer Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>Money Transfer</h3>
                <p>Our platform offers guidance on safe and efficient money transfer options for your tuition fees and living expenses.</p>
            </div>
            
            <!-- Service Card 6: Blocked Account -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/blocked-account-icon.png" alt="Blocked Account Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>Blocked Account</h3>
                <p>We help you open a blocked account, a necessary requirement for student visa applications in Germany.</p>
            </div>
            
            <!-- Service Card 7: APS Certification -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/aps-icon.png" alt="APS Certification Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>APS Certification</h3>
                <p>We provide guidance on obtaining the APS (Academic Evaluation Centre) certification for your application to German universities.</p>
            </div>
            
            <!-- Service Card 8: Accommodation in Germany -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/accommodation-icon.png" alt="Accommodation Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>Accommodation in Germany</h3>
                <p>We assist you in finding safe and affordable accommodation options in Germany during your study period.</p>
            </div>
            
            <!-- Service Card 9: Visa Assistance -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/visa-icon.png" alt="Visa Assistance Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>Visa Assistance</h3>
                <p>We guide you through the entire process of applying for a German student visa, including documentation and interview preparation.</p>
            </div>
            
            <!-- Service Card 10: Post-Admission Support -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/post-admission-icon.png" alt="Post Admission Support Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>Post-Admission Support</h3>
                <p>We offer continued support after admission, including help with settling in, cultural integration, and academic guidance.</p>
            </div>

            <!-- Service Card 11: Student Health Insurance -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/health-insurance-icon.png" alt="Health Insurance Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>Student Health Insurance</h3>
                <p>We assist in finding suitable student health insurance plans to ensure you're covered while studying in Germany.</p>
            </div>

            <!-- Service Card 12: Student Flight Tickets -->
            <div class="service-card">
                <img src="assets/flight-tickets-icon.png" alt="Flight Tickets Icon" class="service-icon">
                <h3>Student Flight Tickets</h3>
                <p>We help you find affordable flight tickets to Germany and assist with booking your travel arrangements.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>

    <!-- Inquiry Form Section -->
    <section class="form-section" id="contact">
        <h2>Inquiry Form</h2>
        <p>Fill out the form below and we'll guide you through the process of studying in Germany:</p>
        <form action="https://api.web3forms.com/submit" method="POST">
            <input type="hidden" name="access_key" value="b02abaea-8ef1-4c2a-ad71-40ce082c385c">

            <!-- Name Field -->
            <label for="name">Full Name</label>
            <input type="text" id="name" name="name" required>

            <!-- Email Field -->
            <label for="email">Email Address</label>
            <input type="email" id="email" name="email" required>

            <!-- Message Field -->
            <label for="message">Message</label>
            <textarea id="message" name="message" rows="4" required></textarea>

            <!-- Submit Button -->
            <button type="submit">Submit Inquiry</button>
        </form>
    </section>

    <!-- Footer Section -->
    <footer>
        <p>&copy; 2025 UniPilot. All rights reserved.</p>
    </footer>

    <script>
        // Smooth Scroll Behavior
        document.querySelectorAll('a[href^="#"]').forEach(anchor => {
            anchor.addEventListener("click", function(e) {
                e.preventDefault();

                document.querySelector(this.getAttribute("href")).scrollIntoView({
                    behavior: "smooth"
                });
            });
        });
    </script>
</body>
</html>

Updated CSS for New Services:

Here’s the updated CSS to accommodate the new services and adjust the Inquiry Form width:

css
/* Global Styles */
* {
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
    box-sizing: border-box;
}

body {
    font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
    background-color: #f4f4f4;
    color: #333;
}

/* Header Styles */
.header {
    display: flex;
    justify-content: space-between;
    align-items: center;
    padding: 20px 50px;
    background-color: #003366; /* Dark Blue */
    position: sticky;
    top: 0;
    z-index: 100;
}

.logo-container .logo {
    width: 150px;
}

.navbar ul {
    list-style: none;
    display: flex;
}

.navbar ul li {
    margin-left: 20px;
}

.navbar ul li a {
    text-decoration: none;
    color: white;
    font-weight: bold;
    font-size: 1.1rem;
    transition: color 0.3s ease;
}

.navbar ul li a:hover {
    color: #ff6f61; /* Accent color */
}

/* Hero Section */
.hero {
    background-color: #f2f2f2;
    text-align: center;
    padding: 80px 0;
    color: #003366;
}

.hero h1 {
    font-size: 3rem;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.hero p {
    font-size: 1.5rem;
    color: #666;
}

/* Services Section */
.services-section {
    background-color: white;
    padding: 30px;
    margin: 40px auto;
    width: 80%;
    box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
}

.services-section h2 {
    font-size: 2.5rem;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
    text-align: center;
}

.services-section p {
    font-size: 1.2rem;
    text-align: center;
    color: #666;
    margin-bottom: 40px;
}

/* Services Card Container */
.services-container {
    display: flex;
    flex-wrap: wrap;
    justify-content: space-between;
}

.service-card {
    background-color: #f9f9f9;
    padding: 20px;
    width: 30%;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
    border-radius: 5px;
    box-shadow: 0 2px 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
    text-align: center;
    transition: transform 0.3s ease;
}

.service-card:hover {
    transform: translateY(-10px); /* Hover effect */
}

.service-icon {
    width: 60px;
    height: 60px;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.service-card h3 {
    font-size: 1.5rem;
    color: #003366;
    margin-bottom: 15px;
}

.service-card p {
    font-size: 1rem;
    color: #555;
}

/* Form Section */
.form-section {
    background-color: white;
    padding: 30px;
    margin: 40px auto;
    width: 60%; /* Increased width of inquiry form */
    box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
}

.form-section h2 {
    font-size: 2rem;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.form-section label {
    font-size: 1rem;
    margin-bottom: 5px;
    display: block;
}

.form-section input,
.form-section textarea {
    width: 100%;
    padding: 12px;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
    border: 1px solid #ccc;
    border-radius: 5px;
    font-size: 1rem;
}

.form-section button {
    background-color: #003366; /* Dark Blue */
    color: white;
    font-size: 1.1rem;
    padding: 15px 20px;
    border: none;
    border-radius: 5px;
    cursor: pointer;
    width: 100%;
}

.form-section button:hover {
    background-color: #ff6f61; /* Accent color */
}

/* Footer Section */
footer {
    background-color: #003366;
    color: white;
    text-align: center;
    padding: 20px;
    margin-top: 40px;
}

footer p {
    font-size: 1rem;
}

Changes Made:

  1. Added Two New Services:

    • Student Health Insurance

    • Student Flight Tickets

  2. Adjusted the Width of the Inquiry Form:

    • The form now has width: 60%, making it slightly wider for a more spacious look.

  3. Services Section Layout:

    • The services are now displayed in cards with icons, titles, and descriptions.

    • Flexbox layout ensures the cards are responsive, adjusting to fit the screen size.

Next Steps:

  1. Add Icons/Images: Replace the placeholders like assets/sop-icon.png with actual images or icons for each service.

  2. Test: Open the webpage locally and ensure everything looks as expected.

  3. Deploy: Once you're happy with the result, deploy the site to your chosen platform (e.g., GitHub Pages, Netlify).

Let me know if you need any more changes or assistance with this!
