    color: #003366;
}

Key Changes:

  1. Layout Adjustments:

    • The inquiry form is positioned to the right side, with the left section remaining empty for future content.

    • Padding and margins adjusted to match the design of the reference image.

  2. Form Styling:

    • The form has a clean and structured layout, with all the fields aligned properly.

Let me know if you need any further tweaks!

You said:
ok now just give the css changes for inquiry form
ChatGPT said:

Certainly! Below are the CSS changes specifically for the inquiry form to match your requirements. These changes will make the form aligned to the right and ensure it looks clean, as shown in the reference image you provided.

CSS for Inquiry Form:

css
/* Main Section Layout */
.main-section {
    display: flex;
    justify-content: space-between;
    padding: 50px 20px; /* Adjusted padding for better alignment */
}

/* Left Section - Empty for now */
.left-section {
    flex: 1;
    padding: 20px;
    background-color: #f0f0f0;
    height: 500px; /* Keeps the left section empty for future content */
}

/* Right Section - Inquiry Form */
.right-section {
    flex: 1;
    padding: 20px;
    background-color: white;
    box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
    height: 500px;
    max-width: 500px; /* Controls the width of the form */
    margin-left: 20px;
    border-radius: 8px; /* Rounded corners for the form */
}

.right-section h2 {
    font-size: 2rem;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
    color: #003366;
    text-align: center;
}

.right-section label {
    font-size: 1rem;
    margin-bottom: 5px;
    display: block;
    color: #333;
}

.right-section input,
.right-section select {
    width: 100%;
    padding: 12px;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
    border: 1px solid #ccc;
    border-radius: 5px;
    font-size: 1rem;
}

.right-section button {
    background-color: #003366; /* Dark Blue */
    color: white;
    font-size: 1.1rem;
    padding: 15px 20px;
    border: none;
    border-radius: 5px;
    cursor: pointer;
    width: 100%;
    margin-top: 10px;
    transition: background-color 0.3s ease;
}

.right-section button:hover {
    background-color: #ff6f61; /* Accent color for hover effect */
}

/* Form Fields: Input, Select, and Textarea */
.right-section input[type="text"],
.right-section input[type="email"],
.right-section input[type="tel"],
.right-section select,
.right-section textarea {
    width: 100%;
    padding: 12px;
    border: 1px solid #ccc;
    border-radius: 5px;
    font-size: 1rem;
}

/* Agreement Checkbox */
.right-section input[type="checkbox"] {
    margin-right: 10px;
}

.right-section label[for="agree"] {
    font-size: 0.9rem;
    color: #555;
}

.right-section .captcha {
    margin-top: 10px;
}

/* Add margin-bottom to form fields for spacing */
.right-section .form-field {
    margin-bottom: 15px;
}

/* Adjust margins for the form to look visually appealing */
.right-section form {
    margin: 0 auto;
    max-width: 500px;
    padding: 20px;
}

Explanation of Changes:

  1. Flexbox Layout:

    • The .main-section uses flexbox to divide the screen into a left section (empty for now) and the right section (which contains the inquiry form).

    • The right section (.right-section) is max-width 500px, making it look like the form in the reference image.

  2. Form Elements Styling:

    • The inputs, select dropdowns, and textarea fields have a consistent padding and border radius to match the modern design.

    • Margins are adjusted to ensure spacing between each field.

  3. Button Styling:

    • The submit button has a hover effect, changing color when hovered over (using #ff6f61).

    • The button spans 100% of the width of the form, providing a consistent visual experience.

  4. Text and Labels:

    • Labels and form fields have been styled for clarity and readability, with proper alignment and spacing.

Key Adjustments:

  • The form is now on the right side, with a clean and structured layout.

  • Empty space is reserved on the left side of the page.

  • Consistent margin and padding have been applied to the form fields for a well-spaced, balanced design.

Next Steps:

  1. Ensure the HTML structure is in place, and the form elements (like inputs, selects, and buttons) are correctly wrapped and have their labels.

  2. Test the layout in the browser to ensure it looks like the reference image.

  3. Deploy the website once you're satisfied with the form's appearance.

Let me know if you need further tweaks!

You said:
how to change the margon between pricing section and the inquiry form
ChatGPT said:

To adjust the margin between the Pricing Section and the Inquiry Form, you can update the CSS for the main-section or the pricing-section. This will allow you to either increase or decrease the space between these two sections.

Here’s how you can modify the margins to achieve the desired space between the Pricing Section and the Inquiry Form:

1. Update Margin in CSS for Inquiry Form and Pricing Section:

You can control the space between the Inquiry Form (.right-section) and the Pricing Section (.pricing-section) by updating their margins.

Here’s the change you need:

CSS Changes for Margin Between Sections:

css
/* Main Section Layout */
.main-section {
    display: flex;
    justify-content: space-between;
    padding: 50px 20px; /* Adjusted padding for better alignment */
    margin-bottom: 50px; /* Adds space below the inquiry form */
}

/* Pricing Section */
.pricing-section {
    background-color: white;
    padding: 30px;
    margin: 40px auto;
    width: 80%;
    box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
    text-align: center;
    margin-top: 30px; /* Add margin-top to control the space above the pricing section */
}

/* Optional: If you want to add more space between the inquiry form and pricing section */
.pricing-container {
    margin-top: 40px; /* Optional: Add margin-top if you want more space between cards and the form */
}

Explanation:

  1. margin-bottom in .main-section: This adds space below the inquiry form (right section). Adjust the value to create more or less space.

  2. margin-top in .pricing-section: This adds space above the pricing section to separate it from the inquiry form. You can adjust this value to create the desired gap.

  3. Optional: You can add a margin-top inside the .pricing-container if you want additional space between the pricing cards and the section above it.

Adjusting the Margin for Your Requirements:

  • Increase Margin: If you want more space, simply increase the margin-top value in .pricing-section and margin-bottom in .main-section.

  • Decrease Margin: If the space is too large, decrease the margin values.

Example:

If you want more space between the sections, you can increase the values like this:

css
/* Add more space between the inquiry form and pricing section */
.main-section {
    margin-bottom: 100px; /* More space below the form */
}

.pricing-section {
    margin-top: 60px; /* More space above the pricing section */
}

Test the Layout:

  • After updating the CSS, check the page in your browser to ensure the spacing looks correct.

  • Fine-tune the values based on your visual preference.

Let me know if you need further adjustments!

You said:
/* Global Styles */ * { margin: 0; padding: 0; box-sizing: border-box; } body { font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: #f4f4f4; color: #333; } /* Header Styles */ .header { display: flex; justify-content: space-between; align-items: center; padding: 20px 50px; background-color: #003366; /* Dark Blue */ position: sticky; top: 0; z-index: 100; } .logo-container .logo { width: 150px; } .navbar ul { list-style: none; display: flex; } .navbar ul li { margin-left: 20px; } .navbar ul li a { text-decoration: none; color: white; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.1rem; transition: color 0.3s ease; } .navbar ul li a:hover { color: #ff6f61; /* Accent color */ } /* Left Section - Empty for now */ .left-section { flex: 1; padding: 20px; background-color: #f0f0f0; height: 500px; /* Keeps the left section empty for future content */ } /* Right Section - Inquiry Form */ .right-section { flex: 1; padding: 20px; background-color: white; box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); height: 500px; max-width: 500px; /* Controls the width of the form */ margin-left: 20px; border-radius: 8px; /* Rounded corners for the form */ } .right-section h2 { font-size: 2rem; margin-bottom: 20px; color: #003366; text-align: center; } .right-section label { font-size: 1rem; margin-bottom: 5px; display: block; color: #333; } .right-section input, .right-section select { width: 100%; padding: 12px; margin-bottom: 20px; border: 1px solid #ccc; border-radius: 5px; font-size: 1rem; } .right-section button { background-color: #003366; /* Dark Blue */ color: white; font-size: 1.1rem; padding: 15px 20px; border: none; border-radius: 5px; cursor: pointer; width: 100%; margin-top: 10px; transition: background-color 0.3s ease; } .right-section button:hover { background-color: #ff6f61; /* Accent color for hover effect */ } /* Form Fields: Input, Select, and Textarea */ .right-section input[type="text"], .right-section input[type="email"], .right-section input[type="tel"], .right-section select, .right-section textarea { width: 100%; padding: 12px; border: 1px solid #ccc; border-radius: 5px; font-size: 1rem; } /* Agreement Checkbox */ .right-section input[type="checkbox"] { margin-right: 10px; } .right-section label[for="agree"] { font-size: 0.9rem; color: #555; } .right-section .captcha { margin-top: 10px; } /* Add margin-bottom to form fields for spacing */ .right-section .form-field { margin-bottom: 15px; } /* Adjust margins for the form to look visually appealing */ .right-section form { margin: 0 auto; justify-content: space-between; flex-wrap: wrap; } .pricing-card { background-color: #f9f9f9; padding: 20px; width: 30%; margin-bottom: 20px; border-radius: 8px; box-shadow: 0 2px 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); text-align: center; transition: transform 0.3s ease; } .pricing-card:hover { transform: translateY(-10px); /* Hover effect */ } .pricing-icon img { width: 60px; height: 60px; margin-bottom: 20px; } .pricing-card h3 { font-size: 1.5rem; color: #003366; margin-bottom: 10px; } .pricing-card .price { font-size: 2rem; font-weight: bold; color: #003366; margin-bottom: 15px; } .pricing-card p { font-size: 1rem; color: #555; margin-bottom: 15px; } .pricing-card button { background-color: #003366; /* Dark Blue */ color: white; font-size: 1.1rem; padding: 15px 20px; border: none; border-radius: 5px; cursor: pointer; width: 100%; } .pricing-card button:hover { background-color: #ff6f61; /* Accent color */ } /* Premium Pricing Card */ .pricing-card.premium { background-color: #f0f0f0; border: 2px solid #003366; } /* Pricing Comparison Table */ .pricing-comparison-table { width: 100%; margin-top: 40px; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left; } .pricing-comparison-table th, .pricing-comparison-table td { padding: 15px; border: 1px solid #ddd; } .pricing-comparison-table th { background-color: #f2f2f2; font-size: 1.2rem; } .pricing-comparison-table td { font-size: 1rem; } .pricing-comparison-table tr:nth-child(even) { background-color: #f9f9f9; } /* Highlight "Personalised" and "Admission Guarantee" */ .pricing-comparison-table td { font-weight: normal; } .pricing-comparison-table td:nth-child(2), .pricing-comparison-table td:nth-child(3), .pricing-comparison-table td:nth-child(4) { text-align: center; } .pricing-comparison-table .premium { color: #003366; } /* Admission Process Comparison Table */ .admission-comparison-table { width: 100%; margin-top: 30px; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left; } .admission-comparison-table th, .admission-comparison-table td { padding: 15px; } .post-admission-comparison-table td { font-size: 1rem; } .post-admission-comparison-table tr:nth-child(even) { background-color: #f9f9f9; } /* Highlight "Personalised" and "Admission Guarantee" */ .post-admission-comparison-table td { font-weight: normal; } .post-admission-comparison-table td:nth-child(2), .post-admission-comparison-table td:nth-child(3), .post-admission-comparison-table td:nth-child(4) { text-align: center; } .post-admission-comparison-table .premium { color: #003366; } /* Hero Section */ .hero { background-color: #f2f2f2; text-align: center; padding: 80px 0; color: #003366; } .hero h1 { font-size: 3rem; margin-bottom: 20px; } .hero p { font-size: 1.5rem; color: #666; } /* Services Section */ .services-section { background-color: white; padding: 30px; margin: 40px auto; width: 80%; box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); } .services-section h2 { font-size: 2.5rem; margin-bottom: 20px; text-align: center; } .services-section p { font-size: 1.2rem; text-align: center; color: #666; margin-bottom: 40px; } /* Services Card Container */ .services-container { display: flex; flex-wrap: wrap; justify-content: space-between; } .service-card { background-color: #f9f9f9; padding: 20px; width: 30%; margin-bottom: 20px; border-radius: 5px; box-shadow: 0 2px 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); text-align: center; transition: transform 0.3s ease; } .service-card:hover { transform: translateY(-10px); /* Hover effect */ } .service-icon { width: 60px; height: 60px; margin-bottom: 20px; } .service-card h3 { font-size: 1.5rem; color: #003366; margin-bottom: 15px; } .service-card p { font-size: 1rem; color: #555; } /* Footer Section */ footer { background-color: #003366; color: white; text-align: center; padding: 20px; margin-top: 40px; } footer p { font-size: 1rem; } here is the style css script which I have. can you put the inquiry form in the right side and keep the space in the left which I will mention some things later. but for now keep it empty
ChatGPT said:

To ensure the inquiry form is aligned on the right side of the page, and the left section is left empty for future content, you can update the CSS layout using Flexbox. I'll set the left section to be empty for now and align the form to the right side of the page.

Here’s how we will adjust the CSS:

CSS Changes to Place Inquiry Form on the Right:

  1. main-section will be used to create a flex layout, with the left section and right section.

  2. Left section will remain empty for now, but we’ll ensure it takes up space on the left side.

  3. Right section will hold the form and will have appropriate margins and padding to appear on the right side.

Updated CSS for Inquiry Form Layout:

css
/* Main Section Layout */
.main-section {
    display: flex;
    justify-content: space-between; /* Spaces out the left and right sections */
    padding: 50px 20px; /* Adjusted padding for alignment */
    gap: 40px; /* Adds some space between the left and right section */
}

/* Left Section - Empty for now */
.left-section {
    flex: 1; /* Takes up remaining space */
    padding: 20px;
    background-color: #f0f0f0;
    height: 500px; /* Keeps the left section empty for future content */
}

/* Right Section - Inquiry Form */
.right-section {
    flex: 1;
    padding: 20px;
    background-color: white;
    box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
    height: 500px;
    max-width: 500px; /* Controls the width of the form */
    margin-left: 20px; /* Ensures there is some space between left and right sections */
    border-radius: 8px; /* Rounded corners for the form */
}

.right-section h2 {
    font-size: 2rem;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
    color: #003366;
    text-align: center;
}

.right-section label {
    font-size: 1rem;
    margin-bottom: 5px;
    display: block;
    color: #333;
}

.right-section input,
.right-section select {
    width: 100%;
    padding: 12px;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
    border: 1px solid #ccc;
    border-radius: 5px;
    font-size: 1rem;
}

.right-section button {
    background-color: #003366; /* Dark Blue */
    color: white;
    font-size: 1.1rem;
    padding: 15px 20px;
    border: none;
    border-radius: 5px;
    cursor: pointer;
    width: 100%;
    margin-top: 10px;
    transition: background-color 0.3s ease;
}

.right-section button:hover {
    background-color: #ff6f61; /* Accent color for hover effect */
}

/* Form Fields: Input, Select, and Textarea */
.right-section input[type="text"],
.right-section input[type="email"],
.right-section input[type="tel"],
.right-section select,
.right-section textarea {
    width: 100%;
    padding: 12px;
    border: 1px solid #ccc;
    border-radius: 5px;
    font-size: 1rem;
}

/* Agreement Checkbox */
.right-section input[type="checkbox"] {
    margin-right: 10px;
}

.right-section label[for="agree"] {
    font-size: 0.9rem;
    color: #555;
}

.right-section .captcha {
    margin-top: 10px;
}

/* Add margin-bottom to form fields for spacing */
.right-section .form-field {
    margin-bottom: 15px;
}

/* Adjust margins for the form to look visually appealing */
.right-section form {
    margin: 0 auto;
    max-width: 500px;
    padding: 20px;
}

/* Optional: If you want to add more space between the inquiry form and pricing section */
.pricing-section {
    margin-top: 50px; /* Adds space between the form and the pricing section */
}

/* Optional: To control spacing between pricing cards */
.pricing-container {
    margin-top: 40px; /* Optional: Adds spacing between pricing cards */
}

Explanation of Changes:

  1. Main Section Layout:

    • The .main-section uses flexbox to divide the section into two parts: one for the left section and one for the right section (where the inquiry form will go).

    • gap: 40px is used to add space between the left and right sections.

  2. Left Section:

    • flex: 1 ensures the left section takes up available space but remains empty for future content. It’s given a height of 500px for visual balance.

  3. Right Section (Inquiry Form):

    • The .right-section has a fixed max-width of 500px for the form to control the width and keep it aligned nicely to the right side.

    • Added margin-left: 20px to create a slight space between the left and right sections.

    • The form has clean and modern styles, including rounded corners and a hover effect for the button.

  4. Form Styling:

    • The form fields (input, select, textarea) are styled to ensure uniform padding, border-radius, and font size for a smooth user experience.

  5. Spacing Between Sections:

    • The pricing-section has a margin-top of 50px to give space between the inquiry form and the pricing section.

Testing the Layout:

  • After applying these changes, open the page in the browser and check the layout.

  • Ensure the inquiry form appears on the right with space on the left for future content.

  • Adjust the margin values if you need more or less space between sections.

Let me know if this works for you or if you need any more adjustments!

You said:
I want the inquiry form to look this small. not too big
ChatGPT said:

To make the inquiry form look smaller and similar to the reference image you provided, I will adjust the following:

  1. Reduce the width of the form.

  2. Reduce the padding and font size slightly to make it appear more compact.

  3. Adjust the form fields to match the reference in terms of spacing.

Here are the CSS changes that will resize the form and adjust its appearance:

Updated CSS for a Smaller Inquiry Form:

css
/* Main Section Layout */
.main-section {
    display: flex;
    justify-content: space-between;
    padding: 50px 20px; /* Adjusted padding for alignment */
    gap: 40px; /* Adds space between the left and right section */
}

/* Left Section - Empty for now */
.left-section {
    flex: 1;
    padding: 20px;
    background-color: #f0f0f0;
    height: 500px; /* Keeps the left section empty for future content */
}

/* Right Section - Inquiry Form */
.right-section {
    flex: 1;
    padding: 20px;
    background-color: white;
    box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
    height: auto;  /* Adjust height to fit the content */
    width: 350px;  /* Make the form smaller */
    max-width: 100%;
    margin-left: 20px;
    border-radius: 8px;
}

.right-section h2 {
    font-size: 1.5rem; /* Reduce font size for the title */
    margin-bottom: 15px;
    color: #003366;
    text-align: center;
}

.right-section label {
    font-size: 0.9rem; /* Reduced font size for labels */
    margin-bottom: 5px;
    display: block;
    color: #333;
}

.right-section input,
.right-section select {
    width: 100%;
    padding: 10px;  /* Reduced padding */
    margin-bottom: 15px;  /* Reduced margin */
    border: 1px solid #ccc;
    border-radius: 5px;
    font-size: 0.9rem; /* Reduced font size */
}

.right-section button {
    background-color: #003366; /* Dark Blue */
    color: white;
    font-size: 1rem; /* Reduced font size */
    padding: 12px 20px;  /* Reduced padding */
    border: none;
    border-radius: 5px;
    cursor: pointer;
    width: 100%;
    margin-top: 10px;
    transition: background-color 0.3s ease;
}

.right-section button:hover {
    background-color: #ff6f61; /* Accent color for hover effect */
}

/* Form Fields: Input, Select, and Textarea */
.right-section input[type="text"],
.right-section input[type="email"],
.right-section input[type="tel"],
.right-section select,
.right-section textarea {
    width: 100%;
    padding: 10px;
    border: 1px solid #ccc;
    border-radius: 5px;
    font-size: 0.9rem;  /* Adjust font size */
}

/* Agreement Checkbox */
.right-section input[type="checkbox"] {
    margin-right: 10px;
}

.right-section label[for="agree"] {
    font-size: 0.8rem; /* Adjust font size for the agreement text */
    color: #555;
}

.right-section .captcha {
    margin-top: 10px;
}

/* Add margin-bottom to form fields for spacing */
.right-section .form-field {
    margin-bottom: 10px; /* Reduced spacing between form fields */
}

/* Adjust margins for the form to look visually appealing */
.right-section form {
    margin: 0 auto;
    width: 100%;
    padding: 20px;
}

Explanation of Changes:

  1. Form Width:

    • The .right-section now has a width of 350px, making the form more compact.

    • max-width: 100% ensures that it does not stretch beyond the specified width.

  2. Font Size:

    • The title (h2) and form labels have reduced font sizes (1.5rem for the title and 0.9rem for the labels) to make everything smaller and more compact.

  3. Padding and Margin Adjustments:

    • Form fields (input, select, textarea) have smaller padding (10px) and margin (15px) to make the form appear more compact.

  4. Button Size:

    • The submit button has a smaller font size and padding to match the reduced size of the form.

  5. Spacing:

    • The spacing between form fields is reduced to make the form more compact, and the margin at the bottom of each field is adjusted to 10px.

Testing:

  • After applying these changes, the form should now appear smaller, with reduced margins and padding, similar to the one shown in your reference image.

  • Test the layout in your browser to ensure it matches your desired appearance.

Let me know if you need any further modifications!

You said:
<!-- State Selection --> <label for="state">Select State</label> <select id="state" name="state" required> <option value="">Select State</option> <option value="State1">State 1</option> <option value="State2">State 2</option> </select> here in the state selection section I want it to show all the states of India
ChatGPT said:

To display all the states of India in the State Selection dropdown, I will update the <select> element to include all the states of India as <option> values.

Here’s a list of all the states in India that you can include in the dropdown:

html
<!-- State Selection -->
<label for="state">Select State</label>
<select id="state" name="state" required>
    <option value="">Select State</option>
    <option value="Andhra Pradesh">Andhra Pradesh</option>
    <option value="Arunachal Pradesh">Arunachal Pradesh</option>
    <option value="Assam">Assam</option>
    <option value="Bihar">Bihar</option>

    <option value="Punjab">Punjab</option>
    <option value="Rajasthan">Rajasthan</option>
    <option value="Sikkim">Sikkim</option>
    <option value="Tamil Nadu">Tamil Nadu</option>
    <option value="Telangana">Telangana</option>
    <option value="Tripura">Tripura</option>
    <option value="Uttar Pradesh">Uttar Pradesh</option>
    <option value="Uttarakhand">Uttarakhand</option>
    <option value="West Bengal">West Bengal</option>
    <option value="Andaman and Nicobar Islands">Andaman and Nicobar Islands</option>
    <option value="Chandigarh">Chandigarh</option>
    <option value="Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu">Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu</option>
    <option value="Lakshadweep">Lakshadweep</option>
    <option value="Delhi">Delhi</option>
    <option value="Puducherry">Puducherry</option>
</select>

Explanation:

  • This code will create a dropdown where the user can select any state in India from the list.

  • Each <option> corresponds to a state in India, and the value of each <option> corresponds to the state name.

  • I have also included Union Territories like Delhi, Chandigarh, Puducherry, etc., as part of the list.

Optional Improvement:

If you expect to have a lot of states in the dropdown and want it to be more user-friendly, you could consider using a searchable dropdown using a plugin or JavaScript (e.g., select2 or chosen.js), which allows users to quickly search and select from the list of states.

You said:
<!-- City Selection --> <label for="city">Select City</label> <select id="city" name="city" required> <option value="">Select City</option> <option value="City1">City 1</option> <option value="City2">City 2</option> </select> now here in the city selection section I want it to show cities of a particular state selected. like it the gujarat is selected then all the cities should be shown only for gujarat and so on for other states selection
ChatGPT said:

To make the City Selection dropdown dynamic based on the State Selection, you will need to use JavaScript. When a user selects a state, the City Selection dropdown will update to show only the cities for that selected state.

Here's how you can implement it:

Steps:

  1. HTML Setup: The State Selection dropdown will remain as is. The City Selection dropdown will initially be empty.

  2. JavaScript: You will use JavaScript to update the City Selection dropdown dynamically based on the state selected.

1. Updated HTML for State and City Selection:

html
<!-- State Selection -->
<label for="state">Select State</label>
<select id="state" name="state" required onchange="updateCities()">
    <option value="">Select State</option>
    <option value="Andhra Pradesh">Andhra Pradesh</option>
    <option value="Gujarat">Gujarat</option>
    <option value="Maharashtra">Maharashtra</option>
    <option value="Karnataka">Karnataka</option>
    <!-- Add more states here -->
</select>

<!-- City Selection -->
<label for="city">Select City</label>
<select id="city" name="city" required>
    <option value="">Select City</option>
    <!-- Cities will be populated based on selected state -->
</select>

2. JavaScript to Dynamically Change Cities Based on State:

javascript
function updateCities() {
    // Get the selected state value
    var state = document.getElementById("state").value;
    
    // Get the city select element
    var citySelect = document.getElementById("city");
    
    // Clear any existing options
    citySelect.innerHTML = '<option value="">Select City</option>';
    
    // Define cities for each state
    var cities = {
        "Andhra Pradesh": ["Hyderabad", "Vijayawada", "Visakhapatnam", "Tirupati"],
        "Gujarat": ["Ahmedabad", "Surat", "Vadodara", "Rajkot"],
        "Maharashtra": ["Mumbai", "Pune", "Nagpur", "Aurangabad"],
        "Karnataka": ["Bangalore", "Mysore", "Mangalore", "Hubli"],
        // Add more states and cities as needed
    };

    // Check if the selected state has cities
    if (cities[state]) {
        // Loop through the cities of the selected state and add them to the city select dropdown
        cities[state].forEach(function(city) {
            var option = document.createElement("option");
            option.value = city;
            option.textContent = city;
            citySelect.appendChild(option);
        });
    }
}

Explanation of Changes:

  1. State Dropdown (<select id="state">):

    • The onchange="updateCities()" event handler will trigger the updateCities() function whenever a state is selected.

  2. City Dropdown (<select id="city">):

    • Initially, this dropdown has a placeholder "Select City".

    • The updateCities() function will populate this dropdown with cities based on the selected state.

  3. JavaScript Function (updateCities):

    • The function first retrieves the selected state value.

    • It then clears any existing city options.

    • The cities for each state are defined in an object called cities, where the keys are state names, and the values are arrays of cities in that state.

    • When a state is selected, the function checks if that state has a list of cities, and if it does, it dynamically populates the City Selection dropdown.

How It Works:

  • When a user selects a state (e.g., "Gujarat"), the updateCities() function will populate the City Selection dropdown with cities specific to Gujarat (e.g., Ahmedabad, Surat, etc.).

  • If no state is selected or an invalid state is selected, the City Selection dropdown will remain with the default "Select City" option.

Example of Output:

  1. State Selection: If "Gujarat" is selected:

    • City Selection: The cities like "Ahmedabad", "Surat", "Vadodara", "Rajkot" will be shown in the dropdown.

  2. State Selection: If "Maharashtra" is selected:

    • City Selection: The cities like "Mumbai", "Pune", "Nagpur", "Aurangabad" will be shown in the dropdown.

Optional Enhancements:

  1. Add a "No City Available" Option: You can add an option for states that have no cities listed:

    html
    <option value="">No Cities Available</option>

  2. Styling: You can add additional styles to make the dropdown look better or add a loading spinner if the cities list is long.

Next Steps:

  1. Add More States and Cities: You can easily extend the list of states and cities in the cities object in JavaScript.

  2. Test: Open the webpage and test the State Selection and City Selection functionality to ensure the cities are dynamically updated based on the selected state.

Let me know if you need any further adjustments!

You said:
how to place the javascript script for the cities in the current script
ChatGPT said:

To place the JavaScript script for the dynamic city selection in your current script, follow these steps:

  1. Place the JavaScript code inside a <script> tag at the bottom of the HTML, just before the closing </body> tag. This ensures that the DOM elements are fully loaded before the script runs.

  2. The script will be executed when the user selects a state from the dropdown and will update the cities accordingly.

Here’s how to integrate the JavaScript in your existing code:

Updated HTML with JavaScript for Dynamic City Selection:

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>UniPilot - Inquiry Form</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
</head>
<body>
    <!-- Header Section with Logo and Navigation -->
    <header class="header">
        <div class="logo-container">
            <!-- UniPilot Logo -->
            <img src="/Users/baselto/Desktop/UniPilot/assets/20f8b1fa-ec1b-43e1-a26d-3920a2e4061a.png" alt="UniPilot Logo" class="logo">
        </div>
        <nav class="navbar">
            <ul>
                <li><a href="#home">Home</a></li>
                <li><a href="#services">Services</a></li>
                <li><a href="#pricing">Pricing</a></li>  <!-- Link to Pricing Section -->
                <li><a href="#about">About Us</a></li>
                <li><a href="#contact">Contact</a></li>  <!-- Link to Inquiry Form -->
            </ul>
        </nav>
    </header>
    
    <!-- Hero Section (Title and Tagline) -->
    <section class="hero" id="home">
        <h1>Welcome to UniPilot</h1>
        <p>Your path to studying in Germany starts here.</p>
    </section> 
    
    <!-- Inquiry Form and Empty Left Section -->
    <section class="main-section">
        <div class="left-section">
            <!-- Empty for future content -->
        </div>

        <div class="right-section">
            <h2>Take the First Step towards Germany</h2>
            <form action="https://api.web3forms.com/submit" method="POST">
                <input type="hidden" name="access_key" value="b02abaea-8ef1-4c2a-ad71-40ce082c385c">

                <!-- Name Field -->
                <label for="name">Enter Name *</label>
                <input type="text" id="name" name="name" placeholder="Enter Name" required>

                <!-- Email Field -->
                <label for="email">Enter Email Address *</label>
                <input type="email" id="email" name="email" placeholder="Enter Email" required>

                <!-- Mobile Number Field -->
                <label for="mobile">Enter Mobile Number *</label>
                <input type="tel" id="mobile" name="mobile" placeholder="Enter Mobile Number" required>

                <!-- State Selection -->
                <label for="state">Select State</label>
                <select id="state" name="state" required onchange="updateCities()">
                    <option value="">Select State</option>
                    <option value="Andhra Pradesh">Andhra Pradesh</option>
                    <option value="Gujarat">Gujarat</option>
                    <option value="Maharashtra">Maharashtra</option>
                    <option value="Karnataka">Karnataka</option>
                    <!-- Add more states here -->
                </select>

                <!-- City Selection -->
                <label for="city">Select City</label>
                <select id="city" name="city" required>
                    <option value="">Select City</option>
                    <!-- Cities will be populated based on selected state -->
                </select>

                <!-- Program Selection -->
                <label for="program">Select Program</label>
                <select id="program" name="program" required>
                    <option value="">Select Program</option>
                    <option value="Program1">Program 1</option>
                    <option value="Program2">Program 2</option>
                </select>

                <!-- Captcha -->
                <label for="captcha">Enter text as shown</label>
                <input type="text" id="captcha" name="captcha" placeholder="Enter Captcha" required>

                <!-- Agreement Checkbox -->
                <input type="checkbox" id="agree" name="agree" required>
                <label for="agree">I agree to receive information regarding my submitted inquiry.</label>

                <!-- Submit Button -->
                <button type="submit">Submit</button>
            </form>
        </div>
    </section>
    
    <!-- Pricing Section -->
    <section class="pricing-section" id="pricing">
        <h2>Our Pricing Plans</h2>
        <p>We offer affordable pricing plans to help you with your journey to studying in Germany. Below are our three main plans:</p>
        
        <div class="pricing-container">
            <!-- Pricing Card 1: Value Plan -->
            <div class="pricing-card">
                <div class="pricing-icon">
                    <img src="assets/value-icon.png" alt="Value Plan Icon">
                </div>
                <h3>Value Plan</h3>
                <p class="price">Rs. 49,999</p>
                <p>Up to 10 Applications</p>
                <button class="cta-button">Enroll Now</button>
            </div>

            <!-- Pricing Card 2: Standard Plan -->
            <div class="pricing-card">
                <div class="pricing-icon">
                    <img src="assets/standard-icon.png" alt="Standard Plan Icon">
                </div>
                <h3>Standard Plan</h3>
                <p class="price">Rs. 49,999</p>
                <p>Up to 10 Applications</p>
                <button class="cta-button">Enroll Now</button>
            </div>

            <!-- Pricing Card 3: Premium Plan -->
            <div class="pricing-card premium">
                <div class="pricing-icon">
                    <img src="assets/premium-icon.png" alt="Premium Plan Icon">
                </div>
                <h3>Premium Plan</h3>
                <p class="price">Rs. 1,69,999</p>
                <p>Admission Guarantee*</p>
                <button class="cta-button">Contact Us</button>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>

    <!-- Pricing Comparison Table -->
    <h3>Admission Package Comparison</h3>
    <table class="pricing-comparison-table">
        <thead>
            <tr>
                <th>Features</th>
                <th>Value Plan</th>
                <th>Standard Plan</th>
                <th>Premium Plan</th>
            </tr>
        </thead>
        <tbody>
            <tr>
                <td>Overview</td>
                <td>Up to 10 Applications</td>
                <td>Up to 10 Applications</td>
                <td>Up to 10 Applications</td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
                <td>Validity</td>
                <td>1 Intake</td>

                <td>2 Intakes</td>
            </tr>

                <td>Student Portal</td>
                <td>✔️</td>
                <td>✔️</td>
                <td>✔️</td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
                <td>Admission Guarantee</td>
                <td>❌</td>
                <td>❌</td>
                <td>✔️</td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
                <td>Counselor Support</td>
                <td>Limited</td>

            </tr>

    <script>
        // Smooth Scroll Behavior
        document.querySelectorAll('a[href^="#"]').forEach(anchor => {
            anchor.addEventListener("click", function(e) {
                e.preventDefault();

                document.querySelector(this.getAttribute("href")).scrollIntoView({
                    behavior: "smooth"
                });
            });
        });

        // JavaScript for Dynamic City Selection based on selected state
        function updateCities() {
            var state = document.getElementById("state").value;
            var citySelect = document.getElementById("city");
            citySelect.innerHTML = '<option value="">Select City</option>';
            
            var cities = {
                "Andhra Pradesh": ["Hyderabad", "Vijayawada", "Visakhapatnam", "Tirupati"],
                "Gujarat": ["Ahmedabad", "Surat", "Vadodara", "Rajkot"],
                "Maharashtra": ["Mumbai", "Pune", "Nagpur", "Aurangabad"],
                "Karnataka": ["Bangalore", "Mysore", "Mangalore", "Hubli"]
            };

            if (cities[state]) {
                cities[state].forEach(function(city) {
                    var option = document.createElement("option");
                    option.value = city;
                    option.textContent = city;
                    citySelect.appendChild(option);
                });
            }
        }
    </script>
</body>
</html>

Key Changes:

  1. JavaScript for dynamic city population based on selected state:

    • When a user selects a state (e.g., "Gujarat"), the cities for that state are populated dynamically in the City Selection dropdown.

  2. updateCities() function:

    • The function runs whenever the user selects a state from the dropdown (onchange="updateCities()").

    • It updates the city dropdown based on the selected state using a JavaScript object that maps states to cities.

Testing:

  1. Test the functionality by selecting a state, such as "Gujarat". The City Selection dropdown should populate with cities like Ahmedabad, Surat, etc.

  2. Ensure the form layout and the dynamic city selection are working as expected.

Let me know if you need further adjustments!

You said:
// JavaScript for Dynamic City Selection based on selected state function updateCities() { var state = document.getElementById("state").value; var citySelect = document.getElementById("city"); citySelect.innerHTML = '<option value="">Select City</option>'; var cities = { "Andhra Pradesh": ["Hyderabad", "Vijayawada", "Visakhapatnam", "Tirupati"], "Gujarat": ["Ahmedabad", "Surat", "Vadodara", "Rajkot"], "Maharashtra": ["Mumbai", "Pune", "Nagpur", "Aurangabad"], "Karnataka": ["Bangalore", "Mysore", "Mangalore", "Hubli"] }; if (cities[state]) { cities[state].forEach(function(city) { var option = document.createElement("option"); option.value = city; option.textContent = city; citySelect.appendChild(option); }); } } ok so right now it is just for few states and few cities. make a complete list of all states with all the cities
ChatGPT said:

To populate the City Selection dropdown dynamically with all the cities of each state in India, we need to update the JavaScript object with all the states of India and their respective cities.

Here's a more comprehensive list of states and cities in India that you can use:

Complete JavaScript Object for States and Cities in India:

javascript
function updateCities() {
    var state = document.getElementById("state").value;
    var citySelect = document.getElementById("city");
    citySelect.innerHTML = '<option value="">Select City</option>';

    var cities = {
        "Andhra Pradesh": ["Hyderabad", "Vijayawada", "Visakhapatnam", "Tirupati", "Rajahmundry", "Kakinada", "Nellore"],
        "Arunachal Pradesh": ["Itanagar", "Tawang", "Ziro", "Pasighat"],
        "Assam": ["Guwahati", "Silchar", "Dibrugarh", "Jorhat", "Nagaon"],
        "Bihar": ["Patna", "Gaya", "Bhagalpur", "Muzaffarpur", "Darbhanga"],
        "Chhattisgarh": ["Raipur", "Bilaspur", "Korba", "Durg", "Raigarh"],
        "Goa": ["Panaji", "Vasco da Gama", "Mapusa", "Margao"],
        "Gujarat": ["Ahmedabad", "Surat", "Vadodara", "Rajkot", "Bhavnagar", "Nadiad"],
        "Haryana": ["Chandigarh", "Gurgaon", "Faridabad", "Ambala", "Hisar", "Karnal"],
        "Himachal Pradesh": ["Shimla", "Manali", "Kullu", "Dharamshala", "Mandi"],
        "Jharkhand": ["Ranchi", "Jamshedpur", "Dhanbad", "Bokaro", "Hazaribagh"],
        "Karnataka": ["Bangalore", "Mysore", "Mangalore", "Hubli", "Belgaum", "Bidar"],
        "Kerala": ["Thiruvananthapuram", "Kochi", "Kozhikode", "Kottayam", "Thrissur", "Palakkad"],
        "Madhya Pradesh": ["Bhopal", "Indore", "Gwalior", "Jabalpur", "Ujjain", "Sagar"],
        "Maharashtra": ["Mumbai", "Pune", "Nagpur", "Aurangabad", "Nashik", "Solapur", "Kolhapur"],
        "Manipur": ["Imphal", "Churachandpur", "Thoubal", "Kangpokpi"],
        "Meghalaya": ["Shillong", "Tura", "Jowai", "Nongpoh"],
        "Mizoram": ["Aizawl", "Lunglei", "Champhai"],
        "Nagaland": ["Kohima", "Dimapur", "Mokokchung"],
        "Odisha": ["Bhubaneswar", "Cuttack", "Rourkela", "Berhampur", "Puri"],
        "Punjab": ["Chandigarh", "Amritsar", "Ludhiana", "Jalandhar", "Patiala", "Bathinda"],
        "Rajasthan": ["Jaipur", "Udaipur", "Jodhpur", "Kota", "Ajmer", "Bikaner"],
        "Sikkim": ["Gangtok", "Namchi", "Mangan", "Jorethang"],
        "Tamil Nadu": ["Chennai", "Coimbatore", "Madurai", "Trichy", "Salem", "Tirunelveli"],
        "Telangana": ["Hyderabad", "Warangal", "Khammam", "Karimnagar"],
        "Tripura": ["Agartala", "Udaipur", "Dharmanagar", "Ambassa"],
        "Uttar Pradesh": ["Lucknow", "Kanpur", "Agra", "Varanasi", "Noida", "Meerut", "Bareilly"],
        "Uttarakhand": ["Dehradun", "Haridwar", "Nainital", "Roorkee", "Rishikesh"],
        "West Bengal": ["Kolkata", "Siliguri", "Durgapur", "Asansol", "Kharagpur"],
        "Andaman and Nicobar Islands": ["Port Blair", "Havelock", "Car Nicobar"],
        "Chandigarh": ["Chandigarh"], // Union Territory
        "Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu": ["Daman", "Diu", "Silvassa"],
        "Lakshadweep": ["Kavaratti", "Andrott", "Minicoy"], // Union Territory
        "Delhi": ["Delhi"], // National Capital Territory
        "Puducherry": ["Puducherry", "Auroville"] // Union Territory
    };

    // Check if the selected state has cities
    if (cities[state]) {
        cities[state].forEach(function(city) {
            var option = document.createElement("option");
            option.value = city;
            option.textContent = city;
            citySelect.appendChild(option);
        });
    }
}

Explanation:

  1. JavaScript Object:

    • This cities object now contains all the states of India with their respective cities. Each state is a key, and the cities are an array of city names.

    • Example: If Gujarat is selected, it will display cities like Ahmedabad, Surat, Vadodara, etc.

  2. updateCities() Function:

    • When the user selects a state, the City Selection dropdown will dynamically populate with cities corresponding to that state.

    • If a state has no cities listed (which would be unlikely for Indian states), the dropdown will simply remain with the default "Select City".

Integrating JavaScript in Your HTML:

Place this JavaScript code inside a <script> tag, right before the closing </body> tag in your HTML file. This will ensure the script runs after the HTML elements are loaded.

html
<script>
// Place the updateCities function code here
</script>

How It Works:

  1. State Dropdown: When the user selects a state (e.g., "Gujarat"), the City Dropdown will be populated with cities like Ahmedabad, Surat, Vadodara, etc.

  2. If the state has no cities (in case of incorrect selection), the city dropdown remains with just the default "Select City" option.

Testing:

  • After updating the HTML and adding the JavaScript, open the form in your browser.

  • Select a state and see the cities update in the City dropdown dynamically.

Let me know if you need further assistance or more features added!

You said:
in the comparison sections how to keep some margin from the side borders of left and right
ChatGPT said:

To add some margin between the comparison tables and the side borders (left and right), you can use padding on the container of the comparison tables or directly on the table itself.

Approach:

  1. Add Padding or Margin to the Table Container:

    • You can wrap the tables in a container div and add padding to that container.

  2. Add Padding to the Table Itself:

    • Alternatively, you can add padding directly inside the tables, but this might require some extra styling for better alignment.

Option 1: Add Padding to the Container (Recommended):

This is the cleanest approach, as it will ensure that the tables are well-aligned with margins on both sides and the layout is consistent.

CSS Update for Comparison Sections:

css
/* Add padding to the container of the comparison tables */
.comparison-container {
    padding: 0 20px; /* Adds padding to the left and right of the table container */
}

/* Pricing Comparison Table */
.pricing-comparison-table {
    width: 100%;
    margin-top: 40px;
    border-collapse: collapse;
    text-align: left;
}

/* Admission Process Comparison Table */
.admission-comparison-table {
    width: 100%;
    margin-top: 30px;
    border-collapse: collapse;
    text-align: left;
}

/* Post Admission Process Comparison Table */
.post-admission-comparison-table {
    width: 100%;
    margin-top: 40px;
    border-collapse: collapse;
    text-align: left;
}

/* Ensure padding for table rows */
.pricing-comparison-table th, .pricing-comparison-table td,
.admission-comparison-table th, .admission-comparison-table td,
.post-admission-comparison-table th, .post-admission-comparison-table td {
    padding: 15px;
    border: 1px solid #ddd;
}

.pricing-comparison-table th,
.admission-comparison-table th,
.post-admission-comparison-table th {
    background-color: #f2f2f2;
    font-size: 1.2rem;
}

HTML Update for Comparison Sections:

html
<!-- Comparison Container -->
<div class="comparison-container">
    <h3>Admission Package Comparison</h3>
    <table class="pricing-comparison-table">
        <thead>
            <tr>
                <th>Features</th>
                <th>Value Plan</th>
                <th>Standard Plan</th>
                <th>Premium Plan</th>
            </tr>
        </thead>
        <tbody>
            <!-- Rows go here -->
        </tbody>
    </table>

    <h3>Admission Process Comparison</h3>
    <table class="admission-comparison-table">
        <thead>
            <tr>
                <th>Admission Process</th>
                <th>Value Plan</th>
                <th>Standard Plan</th>
                <th>Premium Plan</th>
            </tr>
        </thead>
        <tbody>
            <!-- Rows go here -->
        </tbody>
    </table>

    <h3>Post Admission Process Comparison</h3>
    <table class="post-admission-comparison-table">
        <thead>
            <tr>
                <th>Post Admission Process</th>
                <th>Value Plan</th>
                <th>Standard Plan</th>
                <th>Premium Plan</th>
            </tr>
        </thead>
        <tbody>
            <!-- Rows go here -->
        </tbody>
    </table>
</div>

Explanation:

  1. comparison-container:

    • This wrapper container adds padding (padding: 0 20px;) to the left and right sides of the comparison tables. This creates the desired space between the tables and the side borders.

  2. Table Styling:

    • Padding is also added inside the tables (th, td), to ensure the content within the cells is well spaced.

Option 2: Direct Padding on the Table (Alternative)

If you don’t want to add an extra comparison-container div, you can add padding-left and padding-right directly to the comparison tables themselves. Here’s how you can do that:

css
/* Add padding to the table itself */
.pricing-comparison-table,
.admission-comparison-table,
.post-admission-comparison-table {
    padding-left: 20px;  /* Padding from the left */
    padding-right: 20px; /* Padding from the right */
}

/* You can also set margins for the tables */
.pricing-comparison-table,
.admission-comparison-table,
.post-admission-comparison-table {
    margin-left: 20px;
    margin-right: 20px;
}

This way, you’re applying padding directly to the tables, which will also create space from the left and right edges.

Testing:

  • Apply the changes and check the comparison tables to make sure there is adequate space from the left and right side borders.

  • You can adjust the padding and margin values to control the exact spacing.

Let me know if you need any further adjustments!

You said:

color: #666; margin-bottom: 40px; } /* Pricing Card Layout */ .pricing-container { display: flex; justify-content: space-between; flex-wrap: wrap; } .pricing-card { background-color: #f9f9f9; padding: 20px; width: 30%; margin-bottom: 20px; border-radius: 8px; box-shadow: 0 2px 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); text-align: center; transition: transform 0.3s ease; } .pricing-card:hover { transform: translateY(-10px); /* Hover effect */ } .pricing-icon img { width: 60px; height: 60px; margin-bottom: 20px; } .pricing-card h3 { font-size: 1.5rem; color: #003366; margin-bottom: 10px; } .pricing-card .price { font-size: 2rem; font-weight: bold; color: #003366; margin-bottom: 15px; } .pricing-card p { font-size: 1rem; color: #555; margin-bottom: 15px; } .pricing-card button { background-color: #003366; /* Dark Blue */ color: white; font-size: 1.1rem; padding: 15px 20px; border: none; border-radius: 5px; cursor: pointer; width: 100%; } .pricing-card button:hover { background-color: #ff6f61; /* Accent color */ } /* Premium Pricing Card */ .pricing-card.premium { background-color: #f0f0f0; border: 2px solid #003366; } /* Pricing Comparison Table */ .pricing-comparison-table { width: 100%; margin-top: 40px; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left; } .pricing-comparison-table th, .pricing-comparison-table td { padding: 15px; } /* Highlight "Personalised" and "Admission Guarantee" */ .pricing-comparison-table td { font-weight: normal; } .pricing-comparison-table td:nth-child(2), .pricing-comparison-table td:nth-child(3), .pricing-comparison-table td:nth-child(4) { text-align: center; flex-wrap: wrap; justify-content: space-between; } .service-card { background-color: #f9f9f9; padding: 20px; width: 30%; margin-bottom: 20px; border-radius: 5px; box-shadow: 0 2px 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); text-align: center; transition: transform 0.3s ease; } .service-card:hover { transform: translateY(-10px); /* Hover effect */ } .service-icon { width: 60px; height: 60px; margin-bottom: 20px; } .service-card h3 { font-size: 1.5rem; color: #003366; margin-bottom: 15px; } .service-card p { font-size: 1rem; color: #555; } /* Footer Section */ footer { background-color: #003366; color: white; text-align: center; padding: 20px; margin-top: 40px; } footer p { font-size: 1rem; } where in this script changes are required to achieve the desired margins for left and right
ChatGPT said:

To achieve the desired margins between the left and right sections and ensure proper alignment of the inquiry form and pricing section, we will need to focus on the following:

  1. Adjust the layout of the left and right sections to ensure they have appropriate margins and padding.

  2. Adjust the margins and padding in the pricing section to create space between the form and the pricing comparison.

Below, I have highlighted the areas in the current CSS that require changes to achieve your desired margins and spacing.

Changes Needed for Margins Between Left and Right Sections:

  1. Add padding to the left and right sections to ensure there's space between the content and the edges of the container.

  2. Adjust margins in the pricing section to give it space from the form.

CSS Changes for Desired Margins:

1. Main Section Layout:

  • Ensure there’s appropriate space between the left and right sections using gap and padding.

css
/* Main Section Layout */
.main-section {
    display: flex;
    justify-content: space-between;
    padding: 50px 20px; /* Adjust padding for alignment */
    gap: 50px; /* Increased gap to add more space between the left and right section */
}

/* Left Section - Empty for now */
.left-section {
    flex: 1;
    padding: 20px;
    background-color: #f0f0f0;
    height: 500px; /* Keeps the left section empty for future content */
    margin-right: 20px; /* Adds some space on the right of the left section */
}

/* Right Section - Inquiry Form */
.right-section {
    flex: 1;
    padding: 20px;
    background-color: white;
    box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
    height: auto;  /* Adjust height to fit the content */
    width: 350px;  /* Make the form smaller */
    max-width: 100%;
    margin-left: 20px; /* Adds margin to the left of the form */
    border-radius: 8px;
}

2. Pricing Section Margins:

  • The pricing section can have additional top margin to provide spacing between it and the form above.

css
/* Pricing Section */
.pricing-section {
    background-color: white;
    padding: 30px;
    margin: 50px auto; /* Adds space between pricing and the inquiry form */
    width: 80%;
    box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
    text-align: center;
}

.pricing-section h2 {
    font-size: 2.5rem;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.pricing-section p {
    font-size: 1.2rem;
    color: #666;
    margin-bottom: 40px;
}

3. Add Space in the Comparison Tables:

  • We can add padding to the comparison tables to provide space around the content.

css
/* Pricing Comparison Table */
.pricing-comparison-table,
.admission-comparison-table,
.post-admission-comparison-table {
    width: 100%;
    margin-top: 40px;  /* Adds space above the table */
    border-collapse: collapse;
    text-align: left;
    padding-left: 20px; /* Adds padding to the left */
    padding-right: 20px; /* Adds padding to the right */
}

/* Table Header and Cells */
.pricing-comparison-table th,
.admission-comparison-table th,
.post-admission-comparison-table th,
.pricing-comparison-table td,
.admission-comparison-table td,
.post-admission-comparison-table td {
    padding: 15px;
    border: 1px solid #ddd;
}

/* Adjust Column Spacing */
.pricing-comparison-table td,
.admission-comparison-table td,
.post-admission-comparison-table td {
    font-size: 1rem;
    padding-left: 20px; /* Add some left padding for better alignment */
    padding-right: 20px; /* Add some right padding */
}

/* Highlight "Personalised" and "Admission Guarantee" */
.pricing-comparison-table td,
.admission-comparison-table td,
.post-admission-comparison-table td {
    font-weight: normal;
}

.pricing-comparison-table td:nth-child(2),
.admission-comparison-table td:nth-child(2),
.post-admission-comparison-table td:nth-child(2) {
    text-align: center;
}

Explanation of Changes:

  1. Increased gap between left and right sections (.main-section { gap: 50px; }):

    • This will add more space between the two sections and help create a clean layout.

  2. Added margin-right to the left section (.left-section { margin-right: 20px; }):

    • This ensures that the left section has a margin from the right, creating some breathing space.

  3. Adjusted margin and padding in the pricing section (.pricing-section { margin: 50px auto; }):

    • The margin-top in the pricing section ensures there is enough space between the form and the pricing section.

  4. Padding inside tables (.pricing-comparison-table, .admission-comparison-table, .post-admission-comparison-table):

    • This adds padding inside the comparison tables for better spacing between text and table borders.

Testing:

  1. Apply the changes and test the page.

  2. Verify that the inquiry form is placed to the right and that there is appropriate space on the left.

  3. Check that the pricing section is properly spaced from the form.

Let me know if you need further adjustments!

You said:
<!-- Pricing Section --> <section class="pricing-section" id="pricing"> <h2>Our Pricing Plans</h2> <p>We offer affordable pricing plans to help you with your journey to studying in Germany. Below are our three main plans:</p> <div class="pricing-container"> <!-- Pricing Card 1: Value Plan --> <div class="pricing-card"> <div class="pricing-icon"> <img src="assets/value-icon.png" alt="Value Plan Icon"> </div> <h3>Value Plan</h3> <p class="price">Rs. 49,999</p> <p>Up to 10 Applications</p> <button class="cta-button">Enroll Now</button> </div> <!-- Pricing Card 2: Standard Plan --> <div class="pricing-card"> <div class="pricing-icon"> <img src="assets/standard-icon.png" alt="Standard Plan Icon"> </div> <h3>Standard Plan</h3> <p class="price">Rs. 49,999</p> <p>Up to 10 Applications</p> <button class="cta-button">Enroll Now</button> </div> <!-- Pricing Card 3: Premium Plan --> <div class="pricing-card premium"> <div class="pricing-icon"> <img src="assets/premium-icon.png" alt="Premium Plan Icon"> </div> <h3>Premium Plan</h3> <p class="price">Rs. 1,69,999</p> <p>Admission Guarantee*</p> <button class="cta-button">Enroll Now</button> </div> </div> </section> in this section I see a border around the premium plan. how to remove it make the changes
ChatGPT said:

To remove the border around the Premium Plan card, you can modify the CSS that is currently styling the .premium class in the pricing card.

The border around the Premium Plan card is likely coming from the following rule in your CSS:

css
/* Premium Pricing Card */
.pricing-card.premium {
    background-color: #f0f0f0;
    border: 2px solid #003366;  /* This is the border */
}

CSS Changes:

To remove the border, you just need to remove or comment out the border: 2px solid #003366; from the .premium class.

Updated CSS:

css
/* Premium Pricing Card */
.pricing-card.premium {
    background-color: #f0f0f0;
    /* Remove the border property */
    /* border: 2px solid #003366; */ /* Remove this line */
}

Explanation:

  • The Premium Plan card has a specific border defined in the .pricing-card.premium class. By commenting out or removing the border property, the border will no longer appear around the Premium Plan card.

Final HTML:

You don’t need to make any changes to the HTML; the CSS update above will be enough to remove the border from the Premium Plan.

html
<!-- Pricing Card 3: Premium Plan -->
<div class="pricing-card premium">
    <div class="pricing-icon">
        <img src="assets/premium-icon.png" alt="Premium Plan Icon">
    </div>
    <h3>Premium Plan</h3>
    <p class="price">Rs. 1,69,999</p>
    <p>Admission Guarantee*</p>
    <button class="cta-button">Enroll Now</button>
</div>

Result:

  • After applying this CSS change, the border around the Premium Plan card will be removed.

Let me know if you need further adjustments or if you'd like additional changes!

You said:
<!-- Pricing Section --> <section class="pricing-section" id="pricing"> <h2>Our Pricing Plans</h2> <p>We offer affordable pricing plans to help you with your journey to studying in Germany. Below are our three main plans:</p> <div class="pricing-container"> <!-- Pricing Card 1: Value Plan --> <div class="pricing-card"> <div class="pricing-icon"> <img src="assets/value-icon.png" alt="Value Plan Icon"> </div> <h3>Value Plan</h3> <p class="price">Rs. 49,999</p> <p>Up to 10 Applications</p> <button class="cta-button">Enroll Now</button> </div> <!-- Pricing Card 2: Standard Plan --> <div class="pricing-card"> <div class="pricing-icon"> <img src="assets/standard-icon.png" alt="Standard Plan Icon"> </div> <h3>Standard Plan</h3> <p class="price">Rs. 49,999</p> <p>Up to 10 Applications</p> <button class="cta-button">Enroll Now</button> </div> <!-- Pricing Card 3: Premium Plan --> <div class="pricing-card premium"> <div class="pricing-icon"> <img src="assets/premium-icon.png" alt="Premium Plan Icon"> </div> <h3>Premium Plan</h3> <p class="price">Rs. 1,69,999</p> <p>Admission Guarantee*</p> <button class="cta-button">Enroll Now</button> </div> </div> </section> can you add some kind of very basic and simple copyright free logos in all 3 plans
ChatGPT said:

To add basic and simple copyright-free icons or logos to the pricing cards, you can use free icon resources such as Font Awesome or SVG icons.

For simplicity, I'll provide an example using SVG icons (which are lightweight and customizable) and can be easily added to your HTML.

Here’s how you can update your HTML and use basic SVG icons for each plan:

Step 1: SVG Icons for Pricing Plans:

For simplicity, I'll use basic SVGs for each plan. If you prefer, you can replace these with any custom SVG or use a free icon library.

SVG Icons:

  • Value Plan: A simple checkmark icon (✅).

  • Standard Plan: A dollar sign icon for affordability (💲).

  • Premium Plan: A star icon for premium services (⭐).

Step 2: Update HTML with SVG Icons:

html
<!-- Pricing Section -->
<section class="pricing-section" id="pricing">
    <h2>Our Pricing Plans</h2>
    <p>We offer affordable pricing plans to help you with your journey to studying in Germany. Below are our three main plans:</p>
    
    <div class="pricing-container">
        <!-- Pricing Card 1: Value Plan -->
        <div class="pricing-card">
            <div class="pricing-icon">
                <!-- Basic Checkmark Icon (SVG) -->
                <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="40" height="40" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="black" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round">
                    <path d="M20 6L9 17l-5-5"></path>
                </svg>
            </div>
            <h3>Value Plan</h3>
            <p class="price">Rs. 49,999</p>
            <p>Up to 10 Applications</p>
            <button class="cta-button">Enroll Now</button>
        </div>

        <!-- Pricing Card 2: Standard Plan -->
        <div class="pricing-card">
            <div class="pricing-icon">
                <!-- Basic Dollar Sign Icon (SVG) -->
                <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="40" height="40" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="black" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round">
                    <path d="M12 2v20M5 12h14"></path>
                </svg>
            </div>
            <h3>Standard Plan</h3>
            <p class="price">Rs. 49,999</p>
            <p>Up to 10 Applications</p>
            <button class="cta-button">Enroll Now</button>
        </div>

        <!-- Pricing Card 3: Premium Plan -->
        <div class="pricing-card premium">
            <div class="pricing-icon">
                <!-- Basic Star Icon (SVG) -->
                <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="40" height="40" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="black" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round">
                    <path d="M12 17.75l6.28 3.95-4.8-7.14 6.6-5.52-8.6-1.5L12 2 9.92 7.34l-8.6 1.5 6.6 5.52-4.8 7.14L12 17.75z"></path>
                </svg>
            </div>
            <h3>Premium Plan</h3>
            <p class="price">Rs. 1,69,999</p>
            <p>Admission Guarantee*</p>
            <button class="cta-button">Enroll Now</button>
        </div>
    </div>
</section>

Explanation:

  1. SVG Icons:

    • For the Value Plan, I added a checkmark icon (✅) in SVG format.

    • For the Standard Plan, I added a dollar sign icon (💲) in SVG format.

    • For the Premium Plan, I added a star icon (⭐) in SVG format.

  2. SVG Format:

    • SVGs are scalable and can be easily customized. You can adjust their width and height by modifying the width="40" and height="40" attributes.

  3. Placement of Icons:

    • Each icon is placed inside a div with the class pricing-icon inside each pricing card.

Step 3: Optional Customization:

If you want to change the color of the icons, you can adjust the stroke property in the <svg> tags. For example:

  • Change stroke="black" to stroke="#003366" for a dark blue color, or use any other color of your choice.

Additional Note:

  • Font Awesome or other free icon libraries are an alternative to SVGs, but using SVGs gives you more control over the look, and it's lightweight without needing additional libraries.

Let me know if you need any further adjustments or want to replace these with other icons!
